loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Дилафруз жительница города Вахдат. Ей 41 год. Она замужняя женщина. У нее двое детей. Дилафруз очень жизнерадостная и дружелюбная. Ее муж работает строительными работами и разнорабочим по найму. 
Дилафруз вот уже три года как занимается шитьем. Она портниха. Дилафруз работает в ателье. На сегодняшний день она арендует швейную машинку на рабочем месте. 
Дилафруз берет кредит для приобретения швейных машинок. Один она берет для рабочего места, а другой для дома, чтобы продолжит свою работу дома. Она заранее благодарит тех кто ее поддержат!
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a resident of the city of Vahdat. She is 41 years old. She is a married woman with two children. Dilafruz is very cheerful and friendly. Her husband does construction work and a handyman for hire. 

Dilafruz has been working with sewing for three years already. She is a seamstress, and works in a studio. Today she rents a sewing machine at her working place. Dilafruz takes a loan for the purchase sewing machines - one for her work place and one for her home, in order to continue her work there. She thanks all those who support her in advance.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines, in order to work on her own, private machines

loans.name: Diamaguene Group

texts.fr: "DIAMAGUENE" est un groupe de solidarité composé de six femmes, toutes mariées.Elles pratiquent l'activité d'embouche ovine en achetant chaque année des moutons qu'elles engraissent puis revendent. Ce qui leur rapporte des revenus assez consistants leur permettant de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins ainsi que ceux de leurs familles. Le chef de groupe ( en tee- shirt jaune, tenant le mouton) est mère de quatre enfants. Elle aide son mari à supporter les dépenses d'entretien de leurs enfants. Le groupe sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des moutons.
texts.en: Diamaguene is a solidarity group which is made up of 6 woman who are all married. They practise sheep fattening and, each year, buy sheep which they fatten and resell. This earns them quite a consistent income which allows them to take care of their own needs as well as those of their families. The group leader (wearing a yellow t-shirt and holding the sheep) is the mother of 4 children. She supports her husband with their children's living expenses. The group is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds of okra, eggplant, cabbage, and onions.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали житель горда Вахдат. Ему 52 года. Он женат. Шерали живет с женой. У него пятеро детей. Шерали вместе с женой занимается торговлей. Он печет и продает свежую самбусу. Этим видом деятельности Шерали занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для покупки дров, угля, несколько мешков лука и приобретения необходимой посуды.
texts.en:
Sherali is a resident of the city of Vahdat. He is 52 years old and married. Sherali lives with his wife. They have five children. 

Together with his wife, Sherali works with sales. He bakes and sells fresh sambusa. Sherali has worked with this type of activity for five years. He takes a loan for the purchase of wood, coal, several bags of onions and necessary utensils.

loans.use: to purchase wood, coal, several bags of onions and necessary utensils

loans.name: Cécile Rama

texts.fr: Cécile est une femme mariée qui exerce l'activité d'embouche ovine.Elle achète des moutons qu'elle engraisse puis les revend.Elle parvient à obtenir des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi de participer à la prise des charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Sur la photo, elle tient la fiche de contrat pour le pret à l'UIMCEC.Elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter des moutons.
texts.en: Cecile is a married woman who raises sheep.  She buys her sheep, fattens them up, then resells them.   She manages to make enough income to meet her needs and also to contribute to the daily responsibilities of the family.  In the picture, she is holding the contract for the l'UIMCEC loan.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000f to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr: Monsieur El hadji est un homme marié qui habite dans l’une des banlieues de la capitale sénégalaise. Il évolue depuis 20 ans dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément  dans le domaine de la mécanique et exerce  l’achat et la vente de  pièces détachées. Il commence toujours ses activités à  8 heures pour rentrer à 20 heures la nuit.  Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de supporter les frais de scolarité  de ses enfants  et la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son de roulement. Le montant emprunté lui  servira a acheter des lames et des pièces détachées  dans le but d’augmenter son stock et d’ accroitre les bénéfices qu’il réalise. Ainsi il pourra  mieux supporter les frais scolaires des enfants,  épargner davantage d’argent pour ses besoins futurs. Son projet futur est d’avoir un grand garage et des véhicules de transport en commun.
texts.en:
El Hadji is a married man who lives in a suburb of the Senegalese capital. For the past 20 years, he has been involved in the purchase and sale of spare mechanical parts. El Hadji begins his workdays at 8:00 in the morning and finishes at 8:00 in the evening.

The income El Hadji earns from his business allows him to pay for his children's tuition and the daily expenses of his family. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 XOF which he intends to use to expand his business. This loan will serve to buy blades and spare parts in order to increase his stock of merchandise and increase the income he earns. This will allow El Hadji to better pay for his children's school fees, and save more money for future needs. His aim is to have a large garage and a fleet of communal transport vehicles.

loans.use: to buy blades and spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme mariée, mère de trois enfants.Elle exerce une activité de commerce.Achète en gros des produits cosmétiques dans la capitale à des prix abordables et les revend au détails dans les marchés de sa localité.Sur la photo, elle se trouve ici dans le guichet de l'UIMECEC. Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de sa famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter des caisses de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en: Marie is a married woman and the mother of 3 children. She is a retailer; she buys cosmetic products wholesale in the capital for affordable prices, and resells them at her local markets to retail customers. In the photograph, she is in a UIMCEC branch. Her business generates an income which allows her to meet her own needs as well as those of her family. She is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs with which to buy some boxes of cosmetic products.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as onions, oil, pepper, garlic, chilies, meat, and fish for her restaurant.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru:
Мухабат жительница города Исфара. Ей 60 лет. Она разведена. У нее большая семья, Мухабат является матерью пятерых детей. Ее сыновья находятся на заработках за рубежом. Сама Мухабат имеет среднее образование. Она четыре года проработала продавщицей. Сейчас Мухабат занимается купле - продажей сухофруктов.
Мухабат берет кредит для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Muhabat is a resident of the city of Isfara. She is 60 years old, and divorced. She has a large family; she is the mother of five children. Her sons are migrant workers abroad. 

Muhabat has secondary education. She has worked as a saleswoman for four years. Currently Muhabat works with buying and reselling dried fruits. Muhabat takes a loan for the purchase of dried fruits, in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried apricots and apples in order to expand her business

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un homme marié, père de six enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école.Il pratique l'agriculture et l'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine.Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de six mois. Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Il sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter un bœuf.
texts.en: Abdoulaye is a married man and the father of 6 children, 3 of whom attend school. He farms and raises livestock, namely practising cattle fattening. He buys cattle which he fattens and resells after 6 months. This business earns him revenues which allow him to meet his needs and those of his family. He is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy an ox.

loans.use: to buy an ox.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru:
Диловар житель города Исфара. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Диловар предоставляет услугу. Он арендует помещение, где открыл студию звукозаписи. Диловар разбирается в музыке. Вот уже десять лет он в этой области. Диловар очень рад, что он открыл свою студию. 
Диловар берет кредит для приобретения необходимых музыкальных инструментов. Он очень признателен тем, кто его поддержат.
texts.en:
Dilovar is a resident of the city of Isfara. He is 27 years old and married. He has two children. Dilovar provides a service. He rents premises where he has opened a recording studio. Dilovar understands music. He has been in this area for more than ten years. 

Dilovar is very happy that he opened his studio. He takes a loan for the purchase of necessary musical instruments. He is very grateful to those that help him.

loans.use: to purchase necessary musical instruments, in order to expand his business even more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building her house

loans.name: Llinset Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Llinset es una clienta casada, su esposo trabaja como contador para una empresa quien le ayuda en los gastos, ella tiene 3 hijos jóvenes dos estudiantes de la universidad  y uno de secundaria por lo que la señora cuida mucho su trabajo en una distribuidora como responsable de ventas desde hace 15 años porque su prioridad es darles la educación a sus hijos y con este empleo ha sido posible el seguir adelante con la familia. Está solicitando el séptimo crédito para la darle fino a la pared interna y puesta de piso en su casa, por lo que necesita comprar cemento, arena, cerámica, ella agradece mucho a Kiva y Afodenic por apoyarla con sus pequeños proyectos.
texts.en:
Llinset is married with three children, two of whom are in college and one of whom is in high school. She helps her husband – who works as an accountant for a company – with expenses. She says that her children are the reason she has worked so hard for 15 years as the sales manager for a distributor. Her priority is to give her children an education, and with her job she has been able to help her family to get ahead. She is requesting her seventh loan to buy the cement, sand and ceramic tile she needs to finish an interior wall and install a floor in her home. 

She is very grateful to Kiva and AFODENIC for helping her with her small building projects.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abou, marié est père de famille et vit dans un petit village situé non loin de la ville principale. Abou est boulanger de profession et a acquis une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans ce domaine. Il sollicite un crédit de 500.000F CFA afin de pouvoir faire face aux charges salariales de sa boulangerie qui se trouve dans la capitale. Il gère la dépense quotidienne de son foyer et paie aussi les frais de scolarité de ses enfants grâce au crédit. 
Comme projet futur, il aimerait à la suite de cela, renforcer sa boutique d’alimentation sise à la ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Abou, a married father with a family, lives in a small village located near a major city. Mr. Abou is a baker by trade and has acquired over twenty years of experience in this domain. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to cope with the salary expenses associated with his bakery, which is found in the capital. Thanks to loans, he manages the day-to-day household expenses and also pays his children's schooling costs.

For the future, he would next like to bolster his grocery store located in the city.

loans.use: to pay the salaries related to operating his bakery

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar est gérant d’une coopérative agricole, il travaille de 8h à 18h. Il est marié et père de famille. Actuellement, il vit en grande famille avec ses parents, ses frères et sœurs, sa femme et ses enfants. Ce qui est une situation embarrassante dès fois c’est pourquoi, il se tourne vers IMCEC pour bénéficier d’un crédit qui lui permettra d’avancer dans ses travaux de construction.
Mettre sa petite famille dans de meilleures conditions de vie, là est son souci majeur.
texts.en: Mr. Boubacar is the manager of a farm cooperative. He works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. He is married and a father with a family. He currently lives in a large family with his parents, brothers, sisters, his wife, and his children. This is an embarrassing situation at times, so he has turned toward IMCEC to obtain a loan enabling him to continue with construction work [on his house]. Providing the best living conditions for his small family is his main concern.

loans.use: to build a house on a parcel of land

loans.name: Marademe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Marademe  est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  majoritairement dans des  familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur neuvième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales,  de beignets et la prépararion et vente de viandes.
Fanta  debout au milieu de la retauaration avec la préparation vente de viandes. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 petits ruminants (chèvres) auprès de paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes de viandes cuites(vinade grillée et en ragout) au marché de Méridièla, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Marademe group is made up of 5 women who are all married and have an average age of 36 and, on average, 3 children. They mostly live in traditional families in Méridièla, one of the villages in the Bougouni Circle. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better run their businesses, and are on their 9th loan. The previous loans have been properly reimbursed. This group of women sells cereals and doughnuts, and prepares and sells meat.

Fanta, who is standing in the middle of the picture, buys and sells meats. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 small goats from the farmers. She makes her sales of cooked meat (grilled and stewed) at the Méridièla market, at the markets of the surrounding villages and door-to-door, for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 60 000 francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy small goats

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Aminata vit au Sénégal. Elle est célibataire et évolue dans le secteur commercial depuis plus de 03 ans. Sa spécialité dans ce secteur est la vente de tissus.  Elle est membre au niveau de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 200.000 francs CFA prévu pour acheter des  tissus a revendre. Ce premier crédit lui permettra de solidifier son activité commerciale en renforçant  l’offre de produits qu’elle propose a sa clientèle et en même temps d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire. Elle souhaite développer davantage son commerce afin de réaliser son rêve de devenir une grande importatrice de conteneurs de tissus.
texts.en: Ms. Aminata lives in Senegal. She is unmarried and has been working in the commercial sector for over thirty years. Her specialty is this sector is selling cloth. She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch where she is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 francs CFA for purchasing some cloth to resell. This initial loan will enable her to solidify her business by bolstering the products she offers to her customers, and at the same time, by increasing her sales. She would like to  develop her business further in order to realize her dream of becoming a major importer of transportainers of cloth.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad es un campesino que se ha dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria desde su juventud. Aprendió el oficio gracias a sus padres quienes residieron en el campo toda la vida. 
Desde sus catorce años  cultiva café, el cual es uno de los productos más comercializados en su región. Su mayor reto ha sido luchar contra la crisis cafetera, la inestabilidad de los precios y las pestes que invaden constantemente sus cultivos.
Su mayor sueño es poder ofrecerles a sus hijas de doce y catorce años de edad  una buena educación, por lo cual considera la posibilidad de radicarlas en la ciudad, ya que la escuela de la vereda es muy retirada de la finca.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes con el propósito se sacar un buena cosecha y pagarle a los dos empleados que le colaboran con las labores agropecuarias.
Espera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 37, is a farmworker who has made a living in agriculture since his youth.  He learned the work thanks to his parents, who lived in the country all their lives.

He has grown coffee, one of the most marketed crops in the region, since he was 14 years old.  His biggest challenge has been struggling against the coffee crisis, price instability, and pests that constantly invade his crops. 

His biggest dream is to be able to give his children, ages 12 and 14, a good education, for which he's considering the possibility of relocating them to the city because the area school is very far from the farm.

He's requesting a loan to invest in buying fertilizer with the goal of getting a good harvest and paying his two employees who help him with the farming labor.

He hopes to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle s’’est spécialisée dans la commercialisation de balais,  d’huile de palme et de poissons fumés et séchés. Cette activité lui permet  grâce  aux bénéfices générés de participer quotidiennement à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne pour la nourriture de sa famille. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans son activité. Auparavant, elle a obtenu 06 prêts au prés de son guichet a l’U-IMCEC où elle est membre qu’elle a intégralement remboursé. Elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit  d’un montant de 200.000 francs CFA prévu pour  acheter les produits qu’elle commercialise et qui seront destinés  a la vente. C’est dans l’intention de développer son activité de commerce  qu’elle a besoin de ces fonds et parvenir a  satisfaire  la demande croissante de sa clientèle. Ainsi, l’accroissement de ses revenus lui donnera l’opportunité de diversifier les produits proposés sur le marché. Son projet futur consiste toujours à booster son activité en ouvrant un magasin pour y exposer ses  produits.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata lives in Senegal. She is married and has been active in the commercial sector for over twenty years. She specializes in selling brooms, palm oil, dried fish, and smoked fish. This business enables her, thanks to the profits generated, to help manage her family's day-to-day expenses and food situation. She capitalizes on over twenty years of experience in this business. 

Before, she had obtained six loans from her U-IMCEC branch, where she is a member and which she has completely repaid. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 200,000 francs CFA for purchasing the products she sells. With the intention of developing her business, she has need of these funds to achieve the satisfaction of her customers' growing demands. Thus, increasing her revenues will provide the chance to diversify her product offer. Her future plans still include boosting her business by opening a store for displaying her products.

loans.use: to purchase brooms, palm oil, and dried and smoked fish to resell

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: Don Augusto siempre con su labor de seguridad la esposo es ama de casa vela por el orden del hogar. Sus cuatros hijos creciendo cada día más los cuales son su orgullo y los apoya incondicionalmente para el desarrollo de sus estudios, está solicitando su quinto crédito para la construcción del muro frontal de su casa ya que está cubierto de laminas de zinc, necesitara comprar cemento, arena, bloque, piedrines, hierro, esto para mayor privacidad y seguridad dentro de su propiedad, gracias al apoyo de financiamiento podrá lograr este objetivo tan importante para él y su familia.
texts.en:
As always, Augusto still works as a security guard. His wife is a homemaker and keeps the household in order. Their four children are growing more and more each day. They are his pride and joy and he supports them unconditionally in their studies.

He is requesting a fifth loan in order to build the front wall of his house, because it is covered in sheets of zinc. He will need to buy cement, sand, blocks, gravel, and iron, for his property to be safer and have more privacy. Through financing he will be able to achieve this goal, which is very important to him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, blocks, gravel, and iron.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 48 años de edad, ha construido su negocio con esfuerzo y dedicación. Comenzó vendiendo fritos en una esquina del sector en un carro de comidas rápidas. Con su disciplina y ahorro logró mejorar su negocio y adecuarlo en un local.
Hoy ya lleva tres años dedicado a su microempresa en la cual ha hecho grandes cambios que le han permitido crecer. Desde niño siempre le ha apasionado la cocina por lo cual decidió aprovechar su talento y dedicarse a la elaboración de comidas rápidas. 
Todos los días abre su negocio de ocho de la mañana a diez de la noche, cuenta con los servicios de un empleado que le colabora medio tiempo.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una barra que servirá de mesa con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de recepción de personas. Espera poder seguir acreditando su microempresa y garantizarle empleo  no sólo a una persona si no a muchas más.
texts.en:
Mario, 48 years old, has built his business with effort and dedication. He started selling fried food from a fast food cart on a corner in the area. With his discipline and savings he was able to improve his business and move it to a building.

Today he has been dedicated to his microbusiness for three years. During this time he has made big changes that have allowed him to grow. From the time he was a child he was always passionate about cooking, so he decided to take advantage of his talent and make fast food.

His business is open every day from eight in the morning until ten at night. He has an employee who works for him part-time. 

His biggest dream is to be able to improve his business' facilities. This is why he is asking for a loan that he will use to buy a bar that will serve as a table, with the goal of increasing his capacity to seat people. He hopes to be able to continue to establish his microbusiness and to guarantee employment not just to one person but to many more.

loans.use: to purchase a bar that will serve as a table to seat customers

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Epifania Reyna, tiene 60 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "El MIrador", que está formado por 6 socias; cada una con diferentes negocios.
Hace dos años con un peuqeño capital obtenido de un prestamo inició su negocio de venta de comida, ambientó un espacio en su casa para poder preparar los alimentos para la venta y otro pequeño espacio para atender a los clientes, le ha ido bien pero le gustaría mejorar los utensilios y menaje a utilizar.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los alimentos a vender.
texts.en:
Sra. Epifania Reyna is 60-years old.  She is a member of the communal bank "El Mirador."  The bank is made up of six members, each with a different business. 
Two years ago, with a small amount of capital she got from a loan, Sra. Epifania Reyna started her business selling food.  She set up one space in her house for preparing the food and another small space to serve her customers.  Business has been going well for her, but she would like to upgrade her utensils and kitchenware.
Sra. Epifania Reyna will invest the loan she received in the purchase of supplies for making the food she sells.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Milenio Group

texts.es:
Ana María,tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos mayores. Ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres del Milenio" que está integrado por 6 socias, todas ellas comerciantes con una misma meta, lograr una estabilidad económica a base de trabajo y apoyo conjunto.
Desde hace seis años la Sra. Ana María se dedica a prestar servicio de limpieza en especial en los colegios, desde muy temprano inicia sus labores.
Una de sus metas es tener su propio negocio o a lo mejor poder trabajar en la bodega de algun colegio.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas para iniciar un pequeño negocio.   
Ubicamos a la Sra. Ana Maria segunda de derecha a izquierda con una gorrita roja.
texts.en:
Ana María is 45 years old and has four grown-up children. She belongs to the "Mujeres del Milenio" (Millennium Women) group, which has six members, all of whom are businesswomen with the same goal- to achieve economic stability through work and mutual support.

For six years, Señora Ana María has made a living providing cleaning services, particularly in schools. She starts work very early in the morning.

One of her goals is to have her own business or perhaps work in a school store. She will use the loan to buy sweets to start a small business.

She is second from the right in the red hat.

loans.use: To buy sweets to start a small business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Monsieur Omar habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et gagne sa vie par le biais de l’activité de couture qu’il exerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Il gère son propre atelier. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il a déjà remboursé 4 crédits antérieurs. De nouveau, il sollicite un prêt de 300.000 francs CFA prévu pour la  réfection de  son atelier de couture. Son objectif est d’aménager l’entrée de l’atelier pour le rendre plus attractif ce qui pourra contribuer a l’amélioration du cadre pour ses clients. L’augmentation du nombre de ses clients pourra favoriser l’accroissement de ses revenus réguliers et a mieux supporter les charges de paiement de ses employés. Dans le futur, il souhaite disposer d’un plus grand atelier de couture.
texts.en:
Omar lives in Senegal. He is single and has been making his living as a tailor for more than ten years. He manages his own shop. 

He is a member of a UIMCEC branch, where he has already paid back four previous loans. Now, he is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs CFA to re-decorate his tailor shop. His goal is to improve the entryway of the shop to make it more attractive in order to encourage more customers. 

Increasing the number of his customers will help him earn more each month and support the costs of paying his employees. 

In the future, Omar wishes for a larger tailor shop.

loans.use: re-decorate his tailor shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
Milciades, tiene 31 años de edad, es de origen campesino y se dedicó por varios años al oficio de la agricultura. 
Desde hace un año decidió dedicarse a la fabricación de herraduras,  en compañía con un socio, ya que no contaba con el capital para adecuar la microempresa. Siente que su cambio ha sido para mejorar, pues asegura que sus condiciones de vida han incrementado y le ha brindado a su familia, en especial a su hijo de ocho años de edad mejores posibilidades de educación.

Sueña con tener algún día su propia vivienda y acreditar su negocio, para mejorar su situación económica y garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de varilla de ½ y de 3/8, lámina y carbón para aumentar su capacidad de producción y venta de su producto.
texts.en:
Milciades is 31 years old, he was a peasant and worked as a farmer for several years.

One year ago he decided to work making horseshoes along with a partner, since he didn't have enough capital to establish his own business. He believes this change has been for the best, because he assures us his living standards have improved and he has been able to provide his family - particularly his eight-year-old son - better opportunities for education. 

His dream is to one day own his own home and establish his business, so that his financial situation improves and he may guarantee higher living standards for his family. That is why he is requesting a loan, which he will invest in purchasing 1/2 and 3/8 rods, metal sheets, and charcoal, so that his production capacity and the sales of his products increase.

loans.use: to purchase 1/2 and 3/8 rods, metal sheets, and charcoal.

loans.name: Napoleón

texts.es:
Napoleón de 66 años de edad, es una representación del empuje y la perseverancia que caracteriza a los colombianos. En su vida le ha tocado vivir grandes experiencias que le han permitido crecer y aprender a cerca de la vida. 
Su familia es lo más importante y el motor que lo impulsa a seguir adelante en búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades de negocio para garantizarles una estabilidad económica y mejores condiciones de vida.
Antes de montar su negocio, Napoleón laboró conduciendo una tracto-mula, actividad, que le permitió adquirir conocimiento en mecánica y cerrajería. Conocimientos que aprovechó para convertirse en microempresario y montar su negocio.

En la actualidad presta servicios de mecánica, cerrajería y transporte de acarreos.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en el pago del seguro y restauración de su vehículo ya que ha tenido que frenar el transporte de acarreos por falta de recursos para realizar dicho pago.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 66-years old and an example of the spirit and perseverance that characterize the Colombian people.  Napoleón has been through big experiences in his life that have allowed him to grow and to learn about life.  
Napoleón's family is the most important thing to him.  They are the driving force that propels him forward in search of new business opportunities to guarantee them financial stability and better life conditions. 
Before starting his business, Napoleón worked driving a tractor-trailer, an activity that gave him the opportunity to learn about mechanics and iron-works.  He took advantage of this additional knowledge to become a micro-entrepreneur and open up his business. 

Napoleón currently offers mechanic, iron-works and haulage services.  
He is requesting a loan, which will be used to pay for insurance and repairs to his vehicle.  He has had to stop his haulage services due to a lack of resources to make the above-mentioned payments.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle insurance and to fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Olga Inés

texts.es:
Olga de 28 años de edad, ha sabido como ganarse la vida y generar ingresos para colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Tras una difícil situación económica que afrontaron hace algún tiempo cuando su cónyuge se quedó desempleado, Olga se vio en la necesidad de asumir las responsabilidades de su familia por lo cual se dedicó a la venta de repuestos y accesorios para bicicleta. Actividad que le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de vida en su casa y de paso crear su propia empresa. Esta mujer agradece a Dios por la dificultad que atravesaron, porque asegura que gracias a ésta, sus vidas han mejorado considerablemente y los unió mucho más como familia.

En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de comprar mercancía (repuestos) con el fin de poder mejorar en la calidad en el servicio y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan garantizarle a su hijo de siete años de edad una buena educación.
texts.en:
Olga is 28 years old, and has found a way to make a living and earn money so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. Following a challenging economic situation in which they found themselves some time ago when her partner became unemployed, Olga saw the need to take responsibility for her family, and so she began to work selling spare parts and accessories for bicycles. 

This activity has enabled her to improve living conditions in her home and also establish her own business. This woman thanks God for the difficulties that they overcame, because she insists that thanks to this, their lives have improved considerably and they became much more united as a family.

Today, Olga is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandize (spare parts), with the aim of improving the quality of service and generating greater profits, which will enable her to guarantee her seven year old child a good education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for bicycles.

loans.name: Cristina Del Rosario

texts.es:
Cristina, 42 años de edad, originaria de Managua, acompañada, madre de 3 hijos, debido a sus condiciones de pobreza solo logro finalizar el quinto grado de primaria, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una  pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio, vendiendo repostería,  necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y generar ingreso por sí misma.  Hoy en día con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido sacar adelante su negocio, ya que con las ganancia que le generan sus ventas de repostería ha podido emprender otro negocio como es su pequeña pulpería, de la que se siente muy satisfecha porque le genera ganancias a diarias, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijos, tiene otros ingresos como es el dinero que gana como maestra de repostería.
Sus expectativas es seguir creciendo en su negocio. Cristina esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, aceite, cosméticos y ropa. Con el objetivo de seguir ampliando el negocio y darle una mejor presentación, para atraer más  clientes, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder establecer otro negocio como es una fritanga (Venta de comida típica frita).
texts.en:
Cristina, who is 42-years old, is a native of Managua.  She lives with her partner and is the mother of three children.  Due to her family's poor financial situation, she was only able to complete five years of primary school.  She currently works as a shopkeeper; she owns a small grocery store. She started in the same business field, selling pastries.  But she needed a way to subsist and generate income for herself.  Today, with a lot of effort and hard work, she has made her business a success.  With the earnings generated from her pastry sales, Cristina was able to start another business, her small grocery store.  Cristina feels quite satisfied with her store because it makes her money every day.  She has the support of her children.  And she has another source of income too, the money she earns teaching pastry-making. 
Cristina's hope is to continue growing her business.  She needs the loan to purchase basic supplies like rice, beans, corn, sugar, cooking oil, cosmetics and clothing.  She has as a goal expanding her business and improving her store's appearance in order to attract more customers.  In the future, she plans to establish another business, a "fritanga" (selling local dishes of fried food).

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 26 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 26 est un  sous-groupe d’un groupement d’intérêt économique composé de 10 femmes. Elles se sont unies a travers le groupement et évoluent toutes dans le même  secteur d’activité de commerce. Elles sont représentées par madame  Khary  (personne qui a levé la main sur la photo). C’est une femme mariée qui s’active dans le secteur du commerce principalement dans la vente de poissons depuis plus de 07 ans. Elle est membre  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt en vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement.  En effet, ce crédit lui permettra de développer son activité à travers une augmentation de son offre de produit. De ce fait l’accroissement de ses revenus issus de ce financement pourra l’aider a renforcer le niveau de son épargne  et aussi de participer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Son futur projet consiste à acquérir un réfrigérateur pour la conservation de ses poissons.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 26 is a sub-group of an economic interest group composed of ten women. The group brought them together, and they all work in the same sector of commerce. The women are represented by Ms. Khary (with her hand raised in the photo). She is married and active in commerce, principally in selling beverages for over seven years. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, where she is requesting a loan with the aim of bolstering her working capital. Essentially, this loan will enable her to develop her business by augmenting what she sells. Thus, increasing her revenues through this financing will help to boost her savings and also to help improve her family's living conditions. Her future plans include acquiring a refrigerator for keeping her fish.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheets of zinc, cement, and purlin beams.

loans.name: Adja Saly1 Saint Louis Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de Adja Sali 1 Saint-Louis est inauguré le 09 juillet 2011. Ce groupe est composé de 38 membres. Ces femmes sont en bonne entente.

La représentante de ce groupe, Ndeye Fatou, est une femme mariée de 56 ans avec 03 enfants dont 02 filles. Elle fait du petit commerce de fruits et légumes au marché Sor de Saint-louis et des tissus. Elle fait aussi de la couture. Sur la photo, elle est debout avec la main levée.

Avec son prêt, elle va acheter des tissus.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la maison.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' Adja Sali 1 Saint-Louis was inaugurated on July 9, 2011. This group is composed of 38 members. These women are in harmony.

The group's representative, Ndeye Fatou, is a married women, 56 years old, and she has three children, including two daughters. She does commerce in cloth and in fruit & vegetables at the Sor de Saint-Louis market. She also sews. In the photo, she is standing with her hand raised.

With her loan, she is going to purchase some cloth.

With the profits, she plans on supporting her husband in managing the house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carla Verónika, tiene un hijo de seis años de edad. Ella forma parte de un grupo que recien se ha formado de nombre "Alegría" el cual está integrado por cinco socias todas ellas muy emprendedoras y se han unido para apoyarse mutuamente y sacar adelante sus negocios.
Carla Verónika, se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de ropa, negocio que le permite cubrir sus gastos de primera necesidad asi como los estudios de su pequeño hijo.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de disfraces, ya que piensa implementar en su negocio el alquiler de éstas prendas para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carla Veronika has a six-year old child. She is part of a recently formed group called Alegría (Joy) which is composed of five very enterprising members who have come together to support each other and build their businesses.

Carla Veronika has been working in clothing sales for two years, a business that allows her to cover her basic expenses, like an education for her young child.

The loan received will be invested in the purchase of costumes, as she plans to rent them out to expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of costumes.

loans.name: Richar Williams

texts.es:
Richar Williams tiene 27 años de edad. Es estudiante de la carrera de Ingenieria de Sistemas, en una universidad de prestigio reconocida por los buenos profesionales egresados. Desde pequeño tuvo el interés por las computadoras así que cuando termino su secundaria tenía seguridad de que carrera le gustaría estudiar.
Sus padres son su mayor apoyo, son ellos los que asumen los gastos y pagos de la universidad.
El préstamo recibdo lo invertrá en el pago total del ciclo de estudios que dura cinco meses, ya que inicia el segundo año de su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Richar Williams is 27 years old. He is a student in the Systems Engineering program at a prestigious university known for its good professional graduates. He has had an interest in computers ever since he was a little boy, so when he finished secondary school, he was certain what course he wanted to study.

His parents are his greatest support. They are the ones who take on the expenses and payments of the university.

He will invest the loan he receives in the total payment for the term of studies that will last five months, since he is beginning the second year of his professional course.

loans.use: to make  the total payment for a term of studies in systems engineering

loans.name: Sow

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Sow, marié et père de 4 enfants évolue dans la vente de matériaux de construction depuis 10 ans. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour descendre à 20h. Il prend en charge sa femme et ses enfants ainsi que ses frères et sœurs. Il  sollicite un crédit de 400000FCFA pour acheter des planches et du bois de coffrage afin d’augmenter sa productivité. L e crédit lui permettra  aussi de mettre de l’argent de coté.
Il rêve d’être parmi les plus grands fournisseurs de matériaux de construction.
texts.en: Mr. Sow, a married father of four children, has been working at selling construction materials for ten years. He starts his day at 9:00 AM and finishes at 8:00 PM. He supports his wife and children, as well as his brothers and sisters. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to purchase boards and some wooden forms to increase his productivity. The loan will also enable him to put aside some money. He dreams of being among the greatest suppliers of construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to resell

loans.name: Julia Santos

texts.es:
La señora Julia Santos esta casada, tiene 34 años de edad, curso los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, trabajo que empezó para poder mejorar sus ingreso y apoyar a sus padres con los diferentes gastos del hogar, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de un telar y también hilos de varios colores, quiere aumentar su producción y tener nuevos diseños, espera en le futuro contar con mas telares y mas trabajadores.
texts.en:
Julia Santos is 34 years old and is married. She has two children who are in school.  She herself completed two years of primary education. She makes her living by knitting traditional fabrics. She started this business in order to improve her income and support her parents with the various household expenses.  To date she has seven years of experience in this discipline.  Her husband also supports her financially.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy a loom and also yarn in various colors.  She wants to increase her production and create new designs.  She hopes in the future to be able to have more looms and to hire additional workers.

loans.use: To buy yarn and a loom.

loans.name: Maura Maria

texts.es:
Maura, 49  años de edad, originaria de La Isla de Ometepe, pero actualmente vive en Managua, acompañada, madre de 3 hijos, mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la costura hace mas de 23 años, solo logro finalizar su tercer grado de primaria. Ella se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le dio el financiamiento Kiva pues logro comprar la materia prima que necesitaba,mejoraron sus pedidos y con la apertura del año escolar la solicitud de uniformes ha aumentado al igual que pedidos para mas variedad de ropa.

Maura solicita el financiamiento para comprar mas telas, botones, zíper, hilos, etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus trajes y a la misma vez poder cumplir con los encargos que le hacen sus clientes, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder comprar más máquinas de coser, con el objetivo de dar un mejor servicio a su clientela y brindar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Maura, age 49, is from the island of Ometepe, but she currently lives in Managua with her partner. She has three grown children and is a merchant. She has been a seamstress for over 23 years. Maura was only able to finish third grade. She is grateful for the opportunity that her Kiva loan gave her because she was able to buy the basic materials that she needed. Her orders improved. With the beginning of the school year the demand for uniforms has increased as well as orders for a larger variety of clothing.

Maura is requesting this loan for the purchase of more fabric, buttons, zippers, threads, etc. She believes that this loan will allow her to buy all the basic materials that she needs for making her garments. She will be able to fill her clients' orders. Part of her future plans is to be able to buy more sewing machines, with the goal of providing a better customer service and providing employment to more people.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, buttons, zippers, and threads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and fruit.

loans.name: Angela  Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Ángela de 42 años de edad, originaria de la Concepción Masaya, pero tiene 25 años de residir en Managua, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 7, 10 y 15 años respectivamente,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su actividad por iniciativa propia hace 9 años, ya que quería ser una persona independiente y  poder generar ingreso por si misma, con mucho esfuerzo arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante con su negocio, además de las ganancias obtenidas en su negocio ha podido comprar una caponera (bicicleta-taxi) para poder trabajarla y asi tener otros ingresos extras, sus productos lo comercializa en su casa de habitación, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos arroz, frijoles, aceite, jabón, azúcar, pollo y a la misma vez  poder comprar otra caponera. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la mercadería necesaria para seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería, con el propósito  de incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias. Dentro de sus planes futuros es poder convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
42 year-old Angela is originally from Concepción Masaya but has lived in Managua for 25 years. She is married and a mother of 3 children aged 7, 10 and 15. She is a trader and works in a grocery store business.

She started her own business initiative 9 years ago because she wanted to be an independent person and be able to generate her own income. With a lot of hard work she has been able to move forward with her business. What's more, with the profits obtained from her business she has been able to buy a caponera (bicycle-taxi), worked on this, and so been able to have extra income. She sells her products from her home and relies on the support of her husband. 

She is applying for a loan to buy basic rice grain, beans, oil, soap, sugar, chicken and at the same time be able to buy another bicycle-taxi. She thinks that this loan will help her to buy all the merchandise necessary to continue investing in her grocery store. She intends to increase her sales to obtain better profits. In the future she plans to convert her grocery store into a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy basic rice grain, beans, oil, soap, sugar, chicken.

loans.name: Villa Esther Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ESTHER”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Constancia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas de hilo, elaboración de colchones, tienda de barrio, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Constancia es integrante, ella indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de panadería; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que fue el negocio familiar, posteriormente decide independizarse y abrir su propio establecimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “VILLA ESTHER” communal bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Hub. The group has seven members and is governed by a board of directors; Constancia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: weaving blankets; making cushions; a convenience store; and food sales.
This loan will benefit micro entrepreneurs including Constancia. She has been part of Pro Mujer for a year and a half, and joined at the invitation of her sister-in-law, who is part of the institution. Constancia currently has a bakery, and tells us that she learned this business from her parents since it was the family business. She then decided to become independent and open her own establishment.
She will use this loan to increase her capital (to buy flour). She will acquire her flour in the markets in the city of El Alto, wholesale. After baking, she will sell her products in her store. This work allows her to generate an income to help out her household where possible. She is married and has four children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health training and the savings.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Electerio Felipe

texts.es:
Electerio un humilde señor de 53 años de edad, originario de la Ciudad Darío Matagalpa,  pero actualmente vive en Managua, casado, padre de 4 hijos, actualmente solo uno de 7 años esta estudiando, de oficio comerciante, es dueño de una pulpería del que es propietario hace mas de 15 años. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 36 años, trabajando en una empresa, luego decidió renunciar y con la liquidación que le dieron, pudo establecer su propio negocio como es la pulpería, busco  financiamiento para comprar mas productos que aun no tiene en inventario, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa quien le administra su pulpería.
El esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo, mortadelas, queso, crema, embutidos, pan, etc. Con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, unos de sus planes futuros es  poder convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Electerio, a humble man of 53 years, is from the city of Darío Matagalpa but currently lives in Managua. He is married and has four children, but only the 7-year-old is in school. Electerio is a merchant. He has owned a small store for over 15 years. He entered the field at the age of 36, working for a business. He later decided to quit, and used the severance pay to establish his own business: his store. He sought funding to buy more products that he no longer has in his inventory. His wife supports him in the business by managing the store.
He needs this loan for the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, chicken, bologna, cheese, cream, sausages, bread, etc. His goal is to increase his sales in order to make a better income and to be able to satisfy his customers. One of his plans for the future is to be able to convert his store into a distributor.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, chicken, bologna, cheese, cream, sausages, bread.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des ménages monogamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants, les quatre femmes du groupe Djiguiya vivent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Elles font le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques (pommades, parfums et encens), pagnes wax et bazin. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 12ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ami (1ère femme à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax et bazins de qualité dans le quartier Bagadadji Ségou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 18 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle se ravitaille en habits à Bamako et parfois au grand marché de Ségou. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Ami espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
All of them married in monogamous households, the women of the group Djiguiya average 40 years of age and four children each, all living in the Bagadadji district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through community ties. They have small-scale businesses involving cosmetic products (ointments, perfumes, and incense), Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and damask fabrics. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 12th solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Ami, (first woman from the far right in the photo) is a major seller of quality Wax 'pagne' cloth and damask fabrics in the Bagadadji Ségou district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 18 lengths of Wax 'pagne'. She resupplies herself in Bamako and sometimes at the big market in Ségou. 

With the profits, Ms. Ami hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvestment in the business and for taking care of the children.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un groupe composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de petits ruminants, des légumes, du savon et des céréales.                                                                                                                           
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire 
La cliente FATOUMATA ZOUMANA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 3  petits ruminants avec les revendeurs de Nangola, qu’elle revend sur place dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group composed exclusively of married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Tomba, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in small ruminants, vegetables, soap, and grains. The women of the group Djekafo are on their third solidarity loan. 

This client, FATOUMATA ZOUMANA, the second person seated from the right, intends to purchase 3 small ruminants from Nangola retailers and then resell them locally in the village to a customer base composed of men and women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits are reinvested in the commerce of small ruminants.

loans.use: to purchase small ruminants

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME, composé de femmes mariées et une veuve, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Diarani ,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de condiments, d’arachide et font la restauration.                                                                                                                           
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire 
La cliente SETOU, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter quelques chargements de charrettes d’igname à la foire de Nangola avec les revendeurs venus de Sikasso qu’elle revend sur place dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de tubercules.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women and one widow, and its members have an average age of 33 and an average of five children each. They all live in large traditional families in the town of Diarani, located in the region of Koulikoro (the second-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other because they are related, live close to each other, or are friends. They work selling tubers, seasonings and peanuts, and some also work in the restaurant business. The women in this group are on their third group loan.

Setou, who is the first person from left to right in the row of seated group members, wants to buy several cart-loads of yams in Nangola market. She will buy these from resellers from Sikasso, and will sell the yams back home in the village to both male and female customers. Setou plans to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for her family. She will also reinvest part of her profits in her tuber-selling business.

loans.use: To buy yams.

loans.name: Dolo Group

texts.fr: Le  groupe Dolo, composé de femmes mariées et une veuve, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Diarani, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce du poisson fumé, des condiments, du savon, de l’arachide et font la restauration. Les femmes du groupe Dolo sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. La cliente LALA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter  2 paniers de poissons fumé presque chaque foire au marché de Nangola avec les revendeurs qu’elle revend sur place dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de poissons fumé.
texts.en:
The group Dolo is composed of married women and one widow, who average 39 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Diarani, in Commune de Wacoro, Prefecture de Dioïla, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in smoked fish, soap, and peanuts, and they work in food service. The women of the group Dolo are on their third solidarity loan.

This client, LALA, the second person standing from the right in the photo, intends to purchase 2 baskets of smoked fish from retailers at the Nangola market on nearly every market day. She resells locally in the village to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits are reinvested in the commerce of smoked fish.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 29 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal  Akhlakh  GPE  29 est un  sous-groupe  de  Makarimal Akhlakh (groupement d’intérêt économique) composé de 10 femmes. Elles évoluent  toutes dans le secteur du commerce  et exercent la vente de tissus, de produits cosmétiques et d’autres produits divers. Elles sont  représentées  par madame Oumou  Hamath  Mamadou  (personne qui a levé la main sur la photo). Elle est mariée et pratique la vente de tissus  et de produits cosmétiques depuis plus de 7 ans.  Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui  permettent de participer dans la gestion de la nourriture au sein de sa famille. Elle commence sa journée à 9 heures le matin pour la terminer à 18 heures.  Elle est membre   d’un des  guichets de l’UIMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de produits qu’elle commercialise et qui sont  destinés   à la vente dans le but  d’élargir son activité de  commerce. Son objectif est de diversifier la gamme de produits cosmétiques qu’elle commercialise et aussi accroitre ses bénéfices, ainsi elle pourra renforcer sa contribution dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Elle souhaite aussi augmenter le niveau de son épargne. Dans le futur, elle projette d’ouvrir une boutique pour mieux développer  son activité commerciale  et servir sa clientèle
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh GPE 29 is a sub-group of Makarimal Akhlakh (an economic interest group) composed of ten women. They all work in the commerce sector and sell cloth, cosmetic products, and a variety of other goods. 

The women are represented by Ms. Oumou Hamath  Mamadou (with her hand raised in the photo). She is married, and she has been selling cloth and cosmetics for over seven years. The revenues her business brings in enable her to help manage her family's food situation. She starts her day at 9:00 AM and finishes at 6:00 PM.

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan for purchasing the goods that she sells with the goal of expanding her business. Her goal is to diversify the range of cosmetic products she sells and also to increase her profits. Thus, she will be able to help cover day-to-day family expenses. 

She would also like to boost her savings. In the future, she plans to open a store to develop her business further and to sever her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic poducts to resell

loans.name: Yelen Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yelen, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de lait, de petits ruminants, de condiments et du savon.                                                                                                                           
Les femmes du groupe Yelen sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.
La cliente KADIA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter dix à vingt litre de lait frais par jour avec les bergers des villages voisins, qu’elle revend sur place dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de lait.
texts.en:
The group Yelen, composed of married women, average 35 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Tomba, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in milk, small ruminants, condiments, and soap. The women of the group Yelen are on their third solidarity loan.

This client, KADIA, the second person seated from the left in the photo, intends to purchase 10 to 20 liters of fresh milk each day from the shepherds in neighboring villages. She resells the milk locally in the village to a customer base composed of men and women.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits are reinvested in the commerce of milk.

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Jiguisseme. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à KABOILA  village  de la dite commune préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs trente unième prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été correctement rembourssés.
ABI fait le commerce de soumbala dans ce groupe de femmes JIGUISSEME. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 sacs de noix de néré. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Kaboïla village.
Elle les revend après transformation au  grand marché de Sikasso ville le jour de foire et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the Jiguisseme group are married women who are on average 41 years old and who on average have five children. They live mostly in polygamous families in the village of Kaboila in Sikasso prefecture, the third adminstrative region of Mali. They are on their 31st loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which helps them satisfy the needs of their customers. Their previous loans have been repaid on time. 

Among the members of this group, Abi sells soumbala [ground, cooked and fermented beans from the African Locust tree]. With [her portion of] the loan, she hopes to buy ten sacs of beans from the African Locust tree. She procures the beans from villages around Kaboila. After she prepares them, she sells them on special market days in Sikasso with her family to male and female customers. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA, in which a part will be used to pay back the loan and its interest and the other will be used for her savings. She hopes to increase her capital to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To buy néré beans [from the African Locust tree]

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe   SERIEUX sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  ATT BOUGOU un des nouveaux quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme Kadiatou fait le commerce de savon dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient à l’extreme droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 10 cartons de Savon qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché de Medine. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The five members of the group SERIEUX are essentially married women who average 39 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in monogamous families in ATT BOUGOU, a new working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso out of concern for satisfying the needs of their customers. 

Ms. Kadiatou does commerce in soap in this group of women. She is the one standing at the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase about 10 boxes of soap that she sells retail locally and at the Medine market. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit  of 15,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to repay the loan and the interest, and the other part goes toward savings.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe  LA PAIX  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à  ATT BOUGOU un des nouveaux quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme Nassitan fait le commerce de savons dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 10 cartons de Savon qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché de medine. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group LA PAIX are married women averaging 39 years of age and five children each. The women live in monogamous families in ATT BOUGOU, a new working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso out of concern for satisfying the needs of their customers. 

Ms. Nassitan does commerce in soap in this group of women. She is the one standing second from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase about 10 boxes of soap that she sells retail locally and at the Medine market.

She envisions making an average monthly profit  of 15,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to repay the loan and the interest, and the other part goes to savings.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: Kotognogontala. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à KABOILA  village  de la dite commune préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs trente unième prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été correctement rembourssés.
DIALIA fait le commerce de Sounbala dans ce groupe de femmes
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 sacs de noix de néré. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Kaboïla village.
Elle les revend après transformation au  grand marché de Sikasso ville le jour de foire et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500 FCFAdont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotognogontala group are married women, who are on average 45 years old, and who, on average, have five children. They live mostly in polygamous families in the village of Kaboila of the Sikasso prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their thirtieth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This helps them satisfy the needs of their customers. Their previous loans have all been repaid on time. 

Among this group of women, Dialia sells Sounbala [ground, cooked, and fermented seeds of the néré tree]. With [her part of] the loan, she hopes to buy 10 sacs of néré beans [from the African Locust tree]. She procures the beans from the villages around Kaboila. After she prepares the beans, she resells them on special market days in Sikasso with her family to male and female customers.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA, in which a part will be used to pay back the loan and the interest and the other part will be used for her savings.

loans.use: to buy néré beans [from the African Locust tree]

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  SINIGNESSIGUI  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  ATT BOUGOU un des nouveaux quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme    Minata fait le commerce de condiments dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en premirère position de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 1 carton de Cub Magi et le reste à l’oignon qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché de medine. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the group SINIGNESSIGUI are married women, who average 37 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in monogamous families in ATT BOUGOU, a new working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso out of concern for satisfying the needs of their customers. 

Ms. Minata does commerce in condiments in this group of women. She is the first person on the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase about one box of Cub Magi and some onions that she sells retail locally and at the Medine market.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay the loan interest, and the other part goes toward savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 3 enfants, les quatre  femmes du groupe Mougnou vivent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments (boites de tomates concentrées, oignon, ail, tomate fraiche, pâte d’arachide,…), habits  pour enfants, pagnes wax et bazin. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 12ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Assan (1ère femme à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de vêtements de toutes sortes dans le quartier Bagadadji Ségou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 complets d’habits pour enfants au grand marché de Ségou. Avec ce prêt, Madame Assan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, assurer les soins de santé et la scolarisation des enfants. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, elle  a pour ambition de faire l’élevage de petits ruminants dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in monogamous families, on average 31 years old with 3 children, the four women of the group Mougnou all live in the Bagadadji de Ségou neighborhood (4th administrative region of Mali). They met through family and neighborhood ties. They sell condiments (boxes of tomato concentrate, onion, garlic, fresh tomatoes, groundnut paste...), clothing for children, "wax pagnes" (colorful African fabric) and "bazin" cloth. 

With the goal of getting fresh supplies for cash, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 12th loan in solidarity. Madam Assan (the first woman to the extreme left in the photo) is a great seller of all kinds of clothing in the Bagadadji Ségou neighborhood. She plans to use her loan to buy 50 outfits for children at the great market of Ségou. 

With this loan, Madam Assan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to ensure the healthcare and schooling of her children. Like the other women in the group, she has the ambition to breed little ruminants in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children.

loans.name: Aïssa

texts.fr:
Madame  Aïssa  est âgée  de 49 ans, mariée  et mère de 4 enfants. elle  vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et leurs enfants au quartier Diamarabougou de la ville de Markala (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonnée très tôt l’école, elle  commença à faire le petit  commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté  elle  évolua seule pour mener la vente de fruits, elle  fait cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise mais également à son emplacement qui est facile d’accès.
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle adhère au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso.
