Ella está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles y útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, borrador, regla, etc. Con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder llegar a convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea. Su meta próxima es establecer otro negocio como es la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Lelis, 39, is a humble merchant from the city of Rama.  She has lived in Managua for 18 years with her partner and her four children.  For four years she has been running her own grocery store, which she began with only a little capital selling ice cream.  She sold enough to invest, little by little, in her business, turning it into a grocery store in an effort to earn more profit.  She sought out financing to buy more products in order to attend to customer demand.  She receives help from her daughter and also has extra income from her partner who works as a taxi driver.

Lelis is requesting a loan to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar and beans, and school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, etc.  In an effort to expand her business and obtain more income, in the future she would like to turn her grocery store into a general store.  Another goal of hers is to set up a food business.

loans.use: To buy staple goods and school materials.

loans.name: Edith Julieth

texts.es:
Edith de 24 años de edad, es una joven radicada en el campo. Al lado de su padre aprendió de las actividades pecuarias y agrícolas, las cuales se convirtieron en el sustento familiar. Desde sus 18 años esta joven lidera las actividades económicas de su hogar, debido a que su padre sufrió una enfermedad que lo dejó en situación de discapacidad para continuar al frente de los oficios. 
Edith diariamente se levanta muy temprano para comenzar su faena, inicia limpiando los cafetales, abonándolos y recogiendo la cosecha, cuida de los pollos y cerdos. Los ingresos generados gracias a estas actividades sirven como base para el sustento de sus padres y su hermana menor.
Su mayor desafió ha sido ser cabeza de familia y enfrentarse a las labores del campo.
En la actualidad, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pollos y concentrado para los cerdos, con el fin de mejorar la situación económica de su familia y garantizarle a su hermana educación.
texts.en:
Edith, 24, is a young woman who lives in the country.  At her father's side she learned about livestock farming and agriculture, which are the family's main source of income.  Since she was 18 she has been managing the household economy, as her father became ill and is unable to continue running the business.

Every morning Edith gets up early to start her work: weeding, fertilizing and harvesting the coffee plantation, while also caring for the chickens and pigs.  The income from these activities is enough to support her parents and younger sister.  Her greatest challenge is being the head of household and running the farm.

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy chickens and pig feed.  This is to improve the family's economic situation and provide her sister with an education.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pig feed.

loans.name: Ferney De Jesús

texts.es:
Ferney de 33 años de edad, fue empleado por más de 17 años en legumbre rías, graneros y mini-mercados, experiencia que le permitió recoger los conocimientos que hoy pone en práctica en su propio negocio, el cual abrió al público desde hace un año. Por situación de orden público, se vio en la necesidad de cerrar su legumbrería y radicarse en otra zona de la ciudad de Medellín, situación que le ocasionó cuantiosas pérdidas monetarias. Pero asegura que la vida de su familia y la suya es más valiosa que el dinero, por lo cual accedió a emigrar del lugar en donde se encontraba radicado.
Desde hace algunos meses comenzó nuevamente con la acreditación de su negocio, dándose a conocer entre los vecinos del sector.
Diariamente se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para comprar la legumbre que comercializará desde las  7 de la mañana a hasta 7 de la noche en su negocio.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de  mercancía para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y fidelizarlos. Espera mejorar su situación económica y garantizarles a sus tres hijos menores de edad una buena educación.
texts.en:
Ferney, 33, worked for 17 years in vegetable and grain stores and mini-markets.  The experience gained allowed him to establish his own business which he opened to the public one year ago.  Due to a public safety situation he had to close his store and set up in the city of Medellín, which cost him a considerable monetary loss.  But he was sure his family's welfare was worth more than the money, so he decided to emigrate.

For some months now he has been establishing his credit and introducing himself to neighbors.  He gets up every morning at 4:00 a.m. to buy vegetables which he starts selling at 7:00 a.m.  He closes business at 7:00 p.m.

He is requesting a loan to buy more goods to meet customer demand and establish loyalty.  He hopes to improve his economy and give his three minor children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Leonor De Jesús

texts.es:
Leonor de 49 años de edad, es una mujer digna de admiración y respeto. Desde hace tres años su esposo sufrió un accidente que lo dejó en situación de discapacidad permanente, por lo cual, debió asumir los gastos del hogar, velar por la salud y el bienestar de su esposo y su hija de cuatro años de edad.
Debido a la difícil situación por la atraviesa su familia, Leonor tomó la determinación de dedicarse a la venta de tintos de forma ambulante, actividad que realiza diariamente desde las cuatro de la mañana. Gracias a su dedicación, esta mujer logró adquirir un carro de comidas rápidas el cual trabaja en horas de la noche, de este modo combinas las dos actividades con el objetivo de generar mayores ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.
Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su hija una buena educación para qué goce de mejores oportunidades. Con el fin de convertirlo en realidad, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos que le permitirán  aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonor, 49, is a woman who is worthy of admiration and respect.  Three years ago her husband had an accident, leaving him incapacitated permanently and her in charge of covering household expenses and caring for her husband's health and four-year-old daughter's welfare.  Because of the family's difficult situation, Leonor decided to start working as a street peddlar selling coffee as early as 4:00 a.m.  Thanks to her dedication, Leonor was able to buy a fast food cart which she uses to work at night.  She combines both activities to generate more income to cover household expenses.

Her greatest goal is to give her daughter a good education so she has access to more opportunities.  In order to reach her goal, she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her business.  She wants to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fast food ingredients.

loans.name: Luis Edwin

texts.es:
Luis de 34 años de edad, se ha dedicado a las labores del campo desde su infancia. Gracias a su padre aprendió de la agricultura, actividad que hoy es su fuente de sostenimiento para el y su familia.
En la actualidad tiene siembra de papa criolla y capira, por lo cual, se encuentra buscando una fuente de financiación para la compra de semillas de arveja y fríjol con lo que podrá ampliar la variedad de producción, abonos, fungicidas e insecticidas. Espera que esta inversión le permita generar mayores ganancias que se verán reflejadas en la calidad de vida de su esposa e hijos.

Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos de ocho y seis años de edad con buenas oportunidades educativas por lo cual trabaja arduamente a fin de garantizarles acceso a la educación y a las recreación.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old. He has worked in farming since his childhood. Thanks to his father, he learned about agriculture, an activity that today is the source of support for him and his family.

Right now he has crops of a local variety of potatoes and capira potatoes. He is seeking a financing source to buy pea and bean seeds which will help him expand his variety of production, as well as fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides. He hopes that this investment will allow him to generate more earnings which will be reflected in his wife and children's quality of life. 

His biggest dream is to see his children, aged eight and six, have good educational opportunities. For this he works hard in order to guarantee them access to education and recreation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Luz Alegría Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ ALEGRÍA”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Damiana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: chiflera, venta de rellenos, venta de estebia, venta de juguetes, tejido de mantas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Damiana es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el primer préstamo que saco de Pro Mujer, ya que anteriormente había trabajado como ayudante de comida y tenía el conocimiento necesario.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “LUZ ALEGRÍA” [Joyful Light] communal bank will begin its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the German Busch center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Damiana is president. The business of the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: selling plantain chips, selling filling, selling stevia, selling toys, weaving blankets, selling food.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro businesswomen. Damiana is one of them and she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago. She joined at the invitation of a developer who visited her at her house. Right now she has a business selling food. She says that she started this business that she took out with Pro Mujer. Previously, she had worked as a food assistant and she had the knowledge she needed. 
 
The koan she will take out now is to increase her capital (buying potatoes). She will acquire them in the city markets in La Paz and later she will prepare them in her sales stall. This work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible. She is married and has six children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and credit trainings.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Roxana Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana, tiene 39 años, tiene dos hijos d elas edades de 16 y 19 años, ella  se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de patitas fritas y rellenos, tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Garita de Lima, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Roxana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que quiere hacer terminar de construir un cuarto en su casa y así poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia La Sra. Roxana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad ya que le ayuda a crecer en su negocio como también en mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Roxana is 39 years old. She has two children, aged 16 and 19. She works making and selling french fries and stuffed hot peppers. Her sales pot is located in the Garita de Lima area. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Roxana is going to use this loan to buy construction materials because she wants to finish building a room in her house and thus offer more comfort to her family. Roxana is a very hard working person who is happy to have the opportunity since it helps her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home construction.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Soern is 34 years old and lives with her family in a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She is married with three children.

Rice farming and fishing have been the main sources for her family’s income for five years. Soern’s husband also complements the income by selling fish. She earns about 15,000 KHR per day from her current business and manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Soern has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member is with VisionFund only this cycle. Soern completely repaid her previous loans which enabled her to provide her family with enough food. She is now leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fishing materials. She hopes to catch a lot of fish to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Saroem is 58 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) helps her run the business. 

Four of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Saroem requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the transportation expenses and help her children go to work on time. 

In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and rebuild her house to make it bigger and much stronger for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Solanh

texts.en:
Solanh, a diligent local peasant residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, is 34 years old and also a mother of three schoolchildren. To deal with the daily basic needs of the family, she manages three hectares of rice crops and four hectares of corn; it is the business that she has been with for more than six years. 

This is the first loan for Solanh with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is applying for 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her family. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily, so she can multiply her income and support her children’s education gradually.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Living in Battambang Province where rice farming is the common business, Srey is 45 years old and has three schoolchildren out of six kids in total. She manages one hectare of rice cultivation and another hectare of sesame planting, which she has been with for more than 14 years. Her husband is a house builder who has used his spare time to support his wife's business as well. 

Having never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she is now applying for her first loan, as she is in need of working capital for her crops. Her requested loan amount is 3,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her farm. Additionally, she will use a portion of it to buy necessary materials to support her husband. She hopes to grow both of her crops healthily and make more profit to support her living as well as her kids’ education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Astrid Carolina

texts.es: La Srta. Astrid es soltera, tiene 21 de edad, Astrid estudia Computación e Informática ella eligió esta profesión porque  es su vocación y considera que es una chica creativa y moderna, Su sueño de Astrid  es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por ella, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y prácticas profesionales. Sabemos que Astrid  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Kiva le ayudaran
texts.en: Astrid is a single woman. She is 21 years old. Astrid is studying Information Technology. She chose this profession because it is her vocation. She considers herself a creative and modern girl. Astrid’s dream is to be able to offer her parents a better quality of life and in some way, give back everything they have done for her. In order to finish growing, she is requesting a new loan to pay for her registration fees and professional internships. We know that Astrid will reach her goal with lots of work, effort and help from Kiva loans.

loans.use: pay for her professional internships and tuition.

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Kimly is 44 years old and married with four children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. 

She earns a living through farming rice and fishing. Having been in this business for 25 years, Kimly can earn about 85,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the first loan for Kimly’s group of four members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine. She hopes to have a decent latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine.

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of four children, Sambat is aged 49 and living in a rural village of Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has two dependent children to take care of and still in school. To support her family, she and her husband grow various kinds of vegetables. To supplement that income, she has been selling grocery items. The current business earns her family about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.

Sambat is in her second cycle with VisionFund. She completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation and use a portion of it to build on her savings to buy a decent motorcycle for her family to use. She hopes to increase the crop yield from her plantation so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Soy is 62 years old and married. She has four children. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, earning a living through farming rice and planting mango. Engaging in this business for 35 years, they can earn about KHR 18,000 per day from the current business.

This is the fourth microloan for Soy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully used the loans to improve her living condition. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Soy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice and mango planting. She hopes to produce more mango and rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice and mango planting.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Noun, 29, is married, has two children and resides in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for several years. To increase their income, she also works for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 12,000 per day and can save about KHR 4,000 each day for future needs. 

Noun’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has used the previous loan to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hope this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to improve her family's life style.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Ny is 41 years old and married. She has five children.

She and her husband earn a living through selling snacks, and they supplement the income by working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for several years, Ny manages to earn about 30,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Ny has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. As the leader, Ny will use her portion to buy more snacks for selling. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more snacks for selling.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
A 47-year-old widow mother of two kids living in Thmor Koul district of Battambang, Touch is a single mother who makes a living through a business of catching crickets to sell (fried cricket is one of the common foods in Cambodia). She has no other business involvement besides this business. She is able to earn up to 35,000 KHR a month from the current business that she has been with for 10 years. To earn more profit, she needs to catch as many more crickets as possible. 

Hence, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. She is a third time borrower for this cycle. She has used her past loan wisely in support of her business, and she can afford to provide meals three times a day for her children from her income. Now, she and her joint member in their group of two are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Touch will use her loan to buy wire and a lamp for an electricity connection for her house. She hopes this purchase will help her to have enough electricity in her household to supply her family’s usage.

loans.use: To buy wire and a lamp for an electricity connection for her house.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 45-year-old married woman. She started her own business of crockery sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope, and upon the advice of her neighbor, she contacted Kashf Foundation to initiate her own business. She offers various types of crockery such as plates and glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. and has a good client list. 

She is the mother of nine children; five of them are school going. She wishes to send her other children to school but is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business, and now she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of dinner sets, tea sets and glasses in larger quantities to cater to more customers. She wishes to spend part of the profits on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of dinner sets, tea sets and glasses in larger quantities to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms. Sughran is 47 years old and a mother of five children. For the past 30 years, Sughran has been running a milk-selling business. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, her sales have increased and so has her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

Ms. Sughran has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her second loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Aged 28 years old, Sarun is a rural villager from the Dambae district earning a living through farming rice and planting cassava as her only main sources of family income. She has been in this business for several years. She has one baby daughter. The current business earns her approximately 15,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sarun’s group consists of two members who are both female. She is a second cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and completely paid back the first loan which has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Sarun will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a business of weaving rugs and shawls for the past 12 years. Parveen has in-depth knowledge of high-quality weaving and her daughters also help in her business. She earns enough money to fulfill the basic necessities of life. 

At present, Parveen enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.  

In order to cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy raw materials such as wool, threads, cutters and tools to increase her sales. She has shown excellent repayment behavior in the past.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wool, threads, cutters and tools to increase her sales.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en:
Ms Shafaqat is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She excels in work of hand embroidery and makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently, which ultimately will help in generating more income. Shafaqat dreams of providing quality education to her children for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run is 46 years old and married. She has three children and lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as garment workers for 28 years. Run is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Run has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. Run, who is the leader, will use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house.

loans.name: Kay's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Kay is a 36-year-old father of five children, three of whom are dependent on him and still in school while the remaining two are under school-age. The main sources of family’s income are from rice farming and working for others for a fee, which he has been in for seventeen years. With his current business, he can earn about KHR 12,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. 

Kay is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group of four to ask for a loan. He going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. Kay hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income so as to improve his standard of living and fulfill his dream to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sung

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Sung is aged 30 years old and married. She and her husband have one baby son. They earn a living through farming rice and her husband works as a paid construction worker; they have been in this business for ten years. With her current business, Sung is able to earn approximately 18,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the first loan for Sung with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house to live in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc was born in 1963. She has three children. Her oldest child has gotten married. Her other two children are a worker and a bread seller. Her husband is a bread maker and earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. Duc raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 18 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to enlarge her pig farm.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, 32, is married with one son, residing in a rural village of the Kror Kor district in Pursat province. To support the family, Chan and her husband have been farming rice on 2-hectares of farmland for 5 years. Together, they can earn about KHR15,000 per day and can save about KHR7,000 each day for their future needs.

Chan has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The previous loans have helped her better support her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy one motorcycle for commuting in her family. Chan hope this loan will enable her to improve her family's life style.

loans.use: To buy one motorcycle for commuting in her family.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Ra is 31 years old and married. She has three dependent children who are still in school. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. 

To better support her family, her husband also catches fish to earn additional income. Having been in this business for ten years, she is able to earn a daily income of about KHR 19,000 to support her family, and she can save about KHR 5,000 per day for their future needs.

This is the first loan for Ra with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fishing materials for supporting her husband’s business. She hopes to catch more fish to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for supporting her husband’s business.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, age 30, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village in the Thmor Koul district of the Battambang province. All of her children are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers, and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. She has been in the rice-farming business for five years, earning about 32,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Mom is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the province of Battambang, Sokhom is a 43-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. She has been farming rice and planting watermelons in the local area to feed her family. To better support her children, her husband also supplements their income by raising cows and working for others for a fee. Together, they earn about 46,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Sokhom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to earn a high yield from her plantation so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is 41 years old, married, and has four children. For the past 10 years, she has been running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband (in the photo). She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only earner. With the passage of time, her sales and income increased. She presently owns two buffaloes and one cow. 

Because of her work, Seema is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and is requesting her second loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk production. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Ms. Shumaila is 39 years old, a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been in the business of decorations sales for many years. She had difficult time after her husband's business failure so she decided to initiate her own business. She beautifully makes decoration items with the use of mirrors and wood. By this time, she has become famous for providing attractive items in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. 

Ms. Shumaila has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. This will help her to purchase raw material including mirrors, paint, cutters and packs of glue and wire. In this way she would be able to get an increase in her earnings and hence can better support her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw material including mirrors, paint, cutters and packs of glue and wire.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat, 28, lives in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham province, and she is married with one son, who is still under school-age. The main family sources of income are from farming rice on one hectare of farmland and planting cassava. Sometimes, her husband works as a paid worker to help their family to earn more income. Sat has been in her business for several years. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sat has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the loans, which have helped her to relieve her family's financial burden and improve their livelihood. She is now leading her group of two to seek a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sahira

texts.en:
Ms Sahira is 25 years old and a married mother of one child. She has expertise in hand-embroidery and has been using her skills to provide for her family for over five years now. Her husband is a rickshaw driver whose income is not sufficient to meet the family's needs. 

Sahira started this line of work at a very young age. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with threads and beads. Three years ago when she borrowed from Kashf for the first time she wished to invest in buying raw materials. Currently she has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) to purchase more spools of thread, with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors. She hopes to increase her income and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Eoern

texts.en:
Eoern, 45, lives in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. She is married. To earn a living, she has been farming rice for several years. To complement her income, she also plants vegetables. The current business earns her about 41,000 KHR per day, and she can manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Eoern is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. With this loan, she will buy fertilizer and for plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and for plowing the field.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children residing in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province, Sitha is 57 years old. She manages one-and-one-half hectares of rice farmland, while her husband works for another for a fee as extra income. Engaged in this business for 15 years, she is able earn about 30,000 KHR each month.

Now, Sitha joins a micro-loan group consisting of two persons who are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pump water for her cash crops. She hopes that her income will increase gradually and enable her to set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pump water for her cash crops.

loans.name: Kouy's Group

texts.en:
Kouy, 37, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province's Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last several years, Kouy has been farming rice and planting cassava to make a living. To complement that income, she works for others for a fee.

Kouy has already taken out and repaid three loans from Kiva's partner VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family's livelihood. After the three loans with VisionFund, she now can earn about 20,000 Riels (KHR) per day to respond to her family's needs and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her rice paddy and cassava so as to sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Living under a wooden house located in Sangke of Battambang Province, Kunthea is 55 years old and a widowed mother of five children, one of whom, still in school, she supports. Kunthea's primary sources of income are a mango farm and a cabbage garden, both of which she has involved in for 30 years.

Because she needs working capital to support her crop husbandry, Kunthea joins a group of two other women to apply for a first loan from VisionFund. Two of them, including Kunthea, are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining member is applying for 500,000 KHR. Kunthea, the group leader, will use her loan portion to buy potash, seeds, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crops on time and earn more income to expand her business for her family’s sake.

loans.use: To buy potash, seeds, and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Ms. Asia is 33 years old, a married woman and a mother of six children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Seven years ago she began a business of bangles sales to contribute in the family income. She offers bangles in different colors and designs to the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase fancy bangles in various colors and sizes to grow her sales. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase fancy bangles in various colors and sizes to grow her sales.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Ms.  Balqees is 47 years old, a married woman and the mother of four children. For the past 20 years, Balqees has been running a business of animal trade with the support of her son. She initiated her own business by buying animals to support her family; her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sale/purchase of animals increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

 Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase one buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Mirambi Tumanyane Group

texts.en:
Mirambi tumanyane group is located in Bunyarugura, rural Ishaka. The group is comprised of both women and men whose major activity is farming and small-scale trade. They fall into different categories including widows, single mothers and a few who are married. 

Lydia is a widow, mother of  four children. She lost her husband six years back. Her four children are all in school; one dependent helps her in her restaurant business.  

Lydia is mainly a small-scale trader with a small restaurant with running capital of UGX 500,000. She supplements her restaurant business with income from her cotton farm which she resorted to after losing her husband so that she could look after her children and send them to good schools, which she does single-handedly.

She will use the loan to buy more food items and utensils for the restaurant and invest some in cotton farming. The proceeds will be used to pay tuition for her children.

The main challenge is rent since she hires the room in which she operates, especially when the rent falls due at school term period and she has to pay tuition for her children at the same time.This usually drains the restaurant. Despite all the challenges,,Lydia is a very hardworking and determined woman and very optimistic since her first-born has now joined senior three. 

The whole group is excited about the partnership with Kiva. The eighth person at the extreme right behind is the Ugafode credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: to buy food items and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Undrakh

texts.en:
Mrs. Undrakh, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

She has been running garment workshop for 6 years. Her husband began working at business  as a full-time employee in June, 2012. Before her husband started working at the business, they both worked at their own garment workshop. But during a work overload period, her husband helps her to operate her garment business. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Tugriks (MNT) to purchase textiles and other materials in large quantity. As a result, she can operate her garment workshop without worrying about an inventory shortage. At this time of year, usually orders of products are at their maximum level and textile and other materials are used greatly.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and other materials in large quantity

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms. Shabana is 37 years old, a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been providing services of flour grinding in her community. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone so she started this business in her home to contribute to the family income. She knows the techniques of grinding well and has ten years of experience in this field.  By this time, she has become famous for providing fine quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of her family members. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. That would help her to cater for more customers time after time which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Nout's Group

texts.en:
Nout is 24 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from a village of Kampong Cham province in Ponhea Krek district. For more than five years, she and her husband have been farming rice and watermelons as primary source of her family’s income. Nout earns additional income by raising pigs and working for others for a fee. Together, they earn about 34,000 KHR per day and save about 12,000 KHR per day for their future needs.

Nout has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles. She used her first loan to make her living conditions better. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and buy piglets to raise. She hopes to increase her crop yield and fatten her pigs so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: El Aguacate  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Aguacate está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, mejorar su estabilidad económica y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Todas las socias son vecinas y compañeras que cada día fortalecen sus lasos de amistad, son personas amables, gentiles y trabajadoras. Viven por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con varios lugares para recorrer y disfrutar de la naturaleza, su cultura y gastronomía cautivan a todos quienes la visitan.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, forma parte del banco comunal El Aguacate desde hace algunos y es una de las socias fundadoras de este banco comunal. 

La Señora. Rosa tiene 32 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 12, 8 y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos se encuentran en la escuela. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar, su esposo se dedica a la construcción.
 
Doña Rosa para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la limpieza de una casa, tiene este trabajo desde hace 3 años y labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos de varias marcas.

Su nuevo crédito va a  invertir en la compra de cosméticos para tener  más variedad. 

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Aguacate [The Avocado] is made up of seven women and one man, who work in different types of economic activities.  All of these activities allow them to cover home expenses, improve their economic stability, and give a better future to their children.  All of the members are neighbors and comrades who strengthen their friendship every day.  They are kind, gentle, and hardworking.  They live in the Monay neighborhood within the city of Cuenca.  Since December 1999, this city has been named a World Heritage site.  The city has many places to walk around and enjoy nature, and everyone who visits is captivated by the city's culture and food.

One of the members of this group is Rosa.  She has been a part of the communal bank El Aguacate for some years and is one of the founding members of this group.

Rosa is thirty-two years old, is married, and has four children (ages 16, 12, 8, and 5) through this marriage.  Her first two children are studying in high school and her two youngest children are in primary school.  They do not have their own home; they live in a relative's house.  Her husband works in construction.

In order to help her husband with the home expenses, Rosa makes a living as a housekeeper.  She has had this job for three years and works Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule.  In her free time, she also makes a living selling various brands of cosmetics door-to-door.

Her new loan is going to be invested in the purchase of cosmetics, so that she can have more variety.

Her goal is to have her own shop where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Triunfadoras está formado por 8 mujeres emprendedoras, que trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a sus familias y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, se dedican al comercio o a los trabajos en el campo, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico se remonta a la época de la colonia. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mayra, vive por la parroquia de Paccha en Cuenca lugar que goza de una gran belleza natural, esta realizando su segundo crédito en el banco comunal Las Triunfadoras y le gusta este grupo porque todas las socias son muy amables.

La Señora. Mayra tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el kínder, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus tíos con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar. 
 
Doña Mayra pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para tener su independencia económica tiene galpones donde cría pollos y cuyes, estos animales los vende en la ciudad. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y  alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es darles a sus hijos la mejor herencia que es el estudio para que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.

Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Triunfadoras is made up of eight enterprising women who work very hard in order to move their families ahead and to be able to give a better future to their children.  They make a living in trade or in working in the countryside.  They are kind and gentle people, and they still maintain the culture and traditions of their small towns.  They live in the surrounding area of Cuenca; this city is bordered by four rivers, and its historic center dates back to the colonial era.

One of the group members is Mayra.  She lives within the Paccha parish in Cuenca, an area that enjoys beautiful nature.  She is making her second loan with the communal bank Las Triunfadoras.  She likes this group because all of the members are very kind.

Mayra is twenty-five years old and is a single mother of two children, ages four and one.  Her first son is in kindergarten.  She does not have her own home; she lives in her uncle's house and helps with the home expenses.

Mayra spends the day at home, taking care of her children.  However, to have her economic independence, she has sheds where she raises chickens and guinea pigs.  She sells these animals in the city.

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, and food for the animals.

Her dream is to give her children the best legacy, which is to study, so that they can become good professionals.

The small photos are of two group members who could not be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and food for the animals.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school in the local area. To support her family, Sina has been working as a farmer growing cassava for more than eight years, while her husband is a paid worker. Her current business earns her about 17,000 KHR per day and she can afford to save 10,000 KHR each day after expenses.

This is Sina’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sina has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. She completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group of two to request a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava planting. With this loan, Sina hopes to grow more healthy cassava to increase her family’s income and to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava planting

loans.name: Kimrat's Group

texts.en:
With two school-aged dependent children, Kimrat is a 26-year-old mother who struggles to make a living growing corn. She has been in this business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 22,200 KHR per day. From her current income, she is able to save up to 5,800 KHR each day after expenses. 

Kimrat and one of the co-borrowers are in their sixth loan cycle and are requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each.  They have joined with the third group member, who is a first-time borrower, requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. Kimrat has managed her past loans wisely to upgrade her lifestyle and improve her business. She has fully repaid her past loans. As the group leader, Kimrat will use her loan portion to fix her house and get it in better condition. She hopes to own a decent house for her family so that she does not need to worry about her house's condition anymore and so she can pay more attention to her income-generating activities.

loans.use: to fix her house and get it in better condition

loans.name: Ruern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province, Cambodia, Ruern is married and has two out of six children to cater for since they are still in school. 

To struggle for a living, she does rice-cropping on hectares of leased farmland. Her husband also helps her on the rice farm and, sometimes, he works as a paid worker to supplement the family’s income. The main challenge for her business is the fruitless crop caused by the shortage of water supply. 

Seeing this challenge, Ruern formed a group of three to apply for a loan in order to overcome this issue. Ruern, whose past loans have been repaid with success, is in the fourth cycle of loans with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). Her previous loan has maintained a standard of living for her family. Moreover, she is able to keep her two children in school. 

Now, the total of her group loan is KHR 1,600,000. Ruern will use her loan portion, in amount of KHR 1,000,000, to pay for leasing fees, potash, and rice seed, and to buy gasoline to pump water for the crops. She hopes to earn more income for her family since she wants to see a bright future for her children, in terms of education, as well as to own a plot of rice farm.

loans.use: to pay for leasing fees, potash, and rice seed, and to buy gasoline for the farm.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Age 43 and a rural villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sinat is a peasant who grows cassava on two hectares of farmland in order to support the daily cost of living for her family. Currently, she has two out of her three children to support as they are still students.

This is the fourth loan for Sinat with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans, which she has repaid back completely, have supported her business promptly through paying labor fees for planting cassava and weeding.

Now she wants to replant her cassava and to plant rubber trees for extra income, so she is requesting a new loan. She hopes that she can gain high yields seasonably so she can keep up a good pace of lifestyle.

loans.use: to replant her cassava and to plant rubber trees for extra income

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Алиджону 47 лет. У него большая семья. Он женат и имеет на воспитании 5 детей.  Алиджон является единственным кормильцем в семье. Уже более 10 лет как Алиджон занимается животноводческой деятельностью. Он покупает коров и телят, откармливает их в течение 1-1,5 месяца и затем продает с наценкой. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес Аличон берет кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Alijon is 47 years old and has a large family. He is married and has 5 children at home. He is the sole breadwinner for the family, and for the last 10 years, he has been working in the field of animal husbandry. He buys cows and calves, fattens them, then in 1 or 1.5 months, he sells them for a profit. Alijon is now seeking a loan for the purchase and sale of cattle. He wants to use the income generated by the loan to increase his family's available financial resources.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rotisserie cooker.

loans.name: Boret

texts.en:
Boret, 41 years old, is a widow living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal, Cambodia. She earns a living by working as a garment worker and she has been in this business for five years, earning about US$12 per day. She is able to save about US$6 each day for future needs. 

Boret has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles and she completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business. She is requesting another loan with VisionFund to buy a vehicle to commute to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper vehicle to go to work.

loans.use: to buy a decent vehicle to commute to work

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A mother of four schoolchildren and one who is a paid worker from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Srey is 46 years old and makes a living through farming. She manages one hectare each for growing cassava and rice, whereas her husband works for others for a fee for extra income.

With 10 years of involvement in the current business, she is able to earn 26,300 KHR per day. Including this loan cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has repaid back her loans with success. Her past loans have relieved her family’s burden and improved her livelihood in a good manner.

Now she joins a group of two to apply for a new loan.  Her requesting amount is 2,000,000 KHR while her joint member is applying for 1,500,000 KHR. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for labor fees for her cash-crops. She hopes to grow her crops fruitfully and healthily with a high-yield return so that she can make more income in order to build a new bigger house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pesticide

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 58, is a rural villager from Thbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham Province(Cambodia). She is married and blessed with four children. To make a living, she works for others for a fee and her husband is a barber. Engaging in this business for 40 years, she is able to earn up to 15,000 KHR per day.

Now, Chea is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans, which enabled her to improve her living conditions. Now, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy a decent motorbike for her husband to earn extra income as a paid motor-taxi service provider. She hopes this purchase will help her husband earn more income from this new business and sustain their family.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreyleak's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Sreyleak is 43 years old and has three children. She has two hectares of land where she grows rice as her main source of income and she works as a paid-worker. She has been in this business for 20 years and is able to earn up to 18,300 KHR per day. 

Now, Sreyleak is in her second loan cycle with VisionFund. Her past loan has improved her lifestyle in a good manner and she has repaid her loan completely. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking for 1,200,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sreyleak will use her loan portion to pay plowing fees. She hopes to gain a high yield from her current business so that she can earn more income to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 53 года. У него среднее техническое образование. Камолиддин женат и имеет пятеро детей. Его сыновья находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сам Каолиддин вместе с одним сыном занимается куплей и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он занят в сфере животноводства более 26 лет и является опытным скотоводом. Одновременно Камолиддин работал механиком в течение 20 лет. Сейчас Камолиддин хочет расширить свой бизнес и с этой целью обратился за кредитом для закупа скота. За счет прибыли он хочет увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Kamoliddin lives in the Khuroson region. He is 53 years old, married, and has 5 children. He has a secondary vocational education. He has sons who are currently working in the Russian Federation, and one son with whom he works buying and selling cattle. Kamoliddin has been doing this type of work for over 26 years and is a very experienced stockman. At the same time, he has spent 20 years working as a mechanic. Now he wants to expand his business, and for this reason, he is seeking a loan to purchase cattle. He wants to use the income generated by this loan to further increase his herd of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, aged 30, is married with one son who goes to school. For a period of four years now, Mohamed has been a taxi driver. The taxi business is difficult, especially when it is not yours, but he still tries to work hard to reach his goals. He works from 6 am to midnight daily and is able to earn a good profit each month. 

This will be Mohamed's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy his own taxi since the previous car did not belong to him (he was employed). He also bought a plot of land where he expects to build a house, he managed to build his mother a house, and he paid household expenses, as well as school fees. He has paid back all his loans successfully. Mohamed will use this loan to start building his house. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house and expand his business by adding other taxis. 

Mohamed will share this loans with his loan group, "Msasani," which has 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start building his house.

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Seat is married and 48 years old. She has six children, four of whom still depend on her as they are still in school. For her family, rice cropping and cassava growing are the main sources of income and she has been working as a farmer for 28 years. 

In need of working capital to support her farmland, Seat formed a borrowing group of two to apply for a new loan. Seat is a third-time borrower, while her co-borrower is a second-time borrower. Both of them are seeking 2,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Seat will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rubber tree and cassava farming. She hopes that this loan will boost her crop productivity and help her maintain her living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rubber tree and cassava farming

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Theng is now 60 years old and widowed. She has three children, one of whom is a dependent and still in school. Theng is a rice farmer and has been engaged in this business for 40 years. She also raises pigs to earn additional income. Her current business earns her about US $11 per day to support her family’s needs and she can afford to save about US $2 each day. 
 
Theng is in her second loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely paid back her first loan, which helped her relieve her family’s financial burdens. With a good business, Theng is applying for another loan so as to buy piglets for raising and pig feed for nourishing them, and she will also use a portion of the loan to spend on building a piggery for her pig business. She hopes to fatten her pigs to sell them for a good price so as to improve her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising and pig feed for nourishing them, as well as to build a piggery

loans.name: Soeurng's Group

texts.en:
Soeurng, 43, is married and a rural farmer from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham Province,Cambodia. She has one child who currently works as a paid-worker at a factory. To make a living, Soeurng cultivates rice on two hectares of land with the support of her husband who use his spare time to earn extra income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 20,400 KHR per day. 

Now, Soeurng leads a microloan group consisting of four female members. Her past loans, which she completely repaid, have supported her business in a gradual manner and she has been able to buy some household items for her family including a cabinet, table, TV, etc. Now, Soeurng and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each, and the two other group members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Soeurng will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for pumping water for her rice. She hopes to gain a larger yield and to earn more income to maintain her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for pumping water for her rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Guliver

texts.en:
Guliver is a 43-year-old married man who lives with his wife and retired mother in Telavi district. His wife is working in a local shop as a saleslady and gets a very small amount of salary. The family owns a milk cow whose milk is used for cheese products. Besides his agricultural activities, Guliver owns a car and serves as a local taxi driver. He is a very experienced driver and is already in this business for 20 years. 

Seeing as how the benzene price is high, not many citizens can afford to use the taxi service. Because of the above mentioned problem, Guliver has decided to change his taxi's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. It will allow Guliver to decrease the price of the service, which will attract many customers. Increasing the number of customers and cutting his costs will positively affect his profit. He will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system.

The increased profit will make Guliver and his family's lives better.

loans.use: To change the fuel system from benzene to gas.

loans.name: Samut's Group

texts.en:
Samut is aged 46 years and married with four children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. One of her children is still in school. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their family by farming rice in the local area. The current business earns them about 10,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they manage to save about 2,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is the first loan for Samut’s group of three with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Samut, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine for her family’s use. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a proper latrine.

loans.name: Kimchan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Kimchan is a 32-year-old mother of four children. She has been working as a paid worker in rubber fields to support her family. Having been in the business for five years, she can make a daily income of 35,000 KHR from her current business and is able to save about 15,000 KHR per day, after expenses, for their future needs.

This is the third loan for Kimchan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She fully repaid loans which have helped her better support her family’s living conditions. She is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy household supplies to use in her family. She hopes to have enough household supplies for her family's consumption and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy household supplies to use in her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
A 47-year-old mother of five children from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Noeurn is a widow who struggles to earn a living through rice cultivation and pig-raising. She has three years of experience in this business, earning about 43,700 KHR per day. A third-time borrower with VisionFund( Kiva’s partner), who has paid back her past loans with success, Noeurn feels so confident that she can improve her living in a good manner and keep her one dependent child in school despite the fact she is a single mother.

Now, she is requesting a loan amount of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to pay for transplanting fees, plowing fees and potash purchasing. Additionally, she will buy feed to fatten her pig. She hopes to make good progress in both her businesses and earn more income so that she can buy more pigs for raising and a small pig-feed milling machine.

loans.use: to pay for transplanting fees, plowing fees and potash purchasing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Parchamo

texts.ru:
Парчамо жительница горда Куляб. Ей 58 лет. Она вдова. У нее один ребенок. Она одна воспитывает своего ребенка. Парчамо занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает женскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности Парчамо занимается несколько лет. В торговле ей помогает ее дочь. 
Парчамо берет кредит для приобретения весенней женской, детской одежды и обуви, чтобы увеличить оборот и взять в аренду еще одну торговую точку для дочери.
texts.en: Parchamo lives in the city of Kulob. She is a 58-year-old widow, and has 1 child that she is raising by herself. She works in sales at the market where she sells women's clothing and footwear. She has been doing this work for several years now. Her daughter helps her in the business. Parchamo is now seeking a loan to buy spring clothes and footwear for women and children so she can increase her turnover and rent another sales outlet for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy spring clothes and footwear for women and children so she can increase her turnover and rent another sales outlet for her daughter

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Norn, a mother of eight children, is 52 years old and a resident from Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer on one and a half hectares of land and her husband is a construction worker. Involved in this business for 35 years, Norn is able to earn up to 26,500 KHR per day. For her, the lack of working capital is the key challenge. 

To tackle this challenges, Norn is leading a group of four members to apply for a new loan. Two members are the third-time borrowers and the other two are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Norn has succeeded in using her past loans to support her family and finally she managed to buy some household materials. Now, her group is borrowing 4,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, Norn will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay a transplanting fee for her farm. She hopes to gain a better crop yield and earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay a transplanting fee for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Franz Fidel

texts.es: El Sr. Franz sigue con su misma actividad de la fabricación de artesanías de bronce,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material para la fabricación de mas artesanías,   cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material, incremento su producción  y ya tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos por este motivo solicito el credito para satisfacer sus demandas.
texts.en: Franz continues to make bronze handicrafts, and he is applying for a loan to purchase material to produce more. His last credit was successful, as he used the funds to buy material and increase production. He will use this loan to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to purchase material for bronze handicrafts (badges and broaches)

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is aged 35 years. He is married with four children, aged 10, 7, 5 and 3 years respectively, of whom two attend school. He is in the produce business, mainly beans and maize sales, and it is a business he has been operating since 2005 as a major source of income to look after the family.

He wants a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings to buy more produce to meet current demand for produce on the market. His dream is to expand the business so that he is in position to transport a full truck of the products to the city for reselling. At that level, he will adequately meet the basic needs of his family.

However, Justus is challenged by the limited capital he has in the business at the moment. He hopes that with the loan advanced to him, the business will soon grow to his expected levels.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is single and has six children. She has a butchery in a busy trading center many kilometers away from Ntungamo town. She received her first loan for 300,000 UGX, which she repaid. Deborah is requesting her second loan for 500.000 UGX, which she will use to pay  tuition for her children and boost her agriculture business by buying seedlings for planting. She will be able to hire labor as well.

Deborah's major challenges include remoteness of area, delayed payments, and price fluctuation. She hopes with the loan her status will soon improve.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Henrry Gustavo

texts.es: El Sr. Henrry   tiene 30 años tiene dos hijos de las edades de 19 y 12  años, El Sr. Henrry   se dedica  a la   fabricación de variedad de Calzados, para cholitas, tiene su taller en la zona de Pasankeri de la  ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, El Sr. Henrry   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de material para la fabricación de calzados como cuero por mayor y otros materiales que necesita para la  fabricación de sus calzados  y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de calzados a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Henrry   va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de material, El Sr. Henrry   es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada,  su deseo es poder producir en mayor cantidad y ofrecer sus productos a distintos mercados  y ferias de los distintos departamentos a nivel Nacional.
texts.en:
Henrry is 30 and has two children, ages 19 and 12. Henrry makes shoes for young women in his workshop in Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. This is his first loan cycle with the institution, and he will use the funds to buy supplies such as wholesale leather to make a variety of shoes for his customers and to grow his business. He will reinvest his profits by purchasing more supplies.  

Henrry is a hard worker and is pleased to have this opportunity. He wants to increase production and offer his merchandise at markets and fairs in other departments throughout the country.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Farzonai

texts.ru:
Фарзона жительница города Куляб. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Фарзона живет с матерью. Ее мать преподает в школе. Сама Фарзона трудолюбивая и доброй души человек. Сейчас она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Благодаря ее стараниям она стала хорошей портнихой. Вот уже год как Фарзона самостоятельно работает в этой области. Она принимает заказы у себя дома. 
Фарзона берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, тканей и ниток, чтобы заняться вышивкой платьев и шить новые виды платьев.
texts.en: Farzonai lives in the city of Kulob. She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her mother. Her mother is a school teacher. Farzonai is a hard-working and kind person. Currently she works sewing national dresses. Thanks to her efforts, she has become a good seamstress, and for the last year, she has been working independently in this area. She takes orders and works from home. She is seeking a loan to purchase a sewing machine, fabrics, and thread so she can embroider dresses and sew new styles of dresses.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine so she can embroider dresses and sew new styles of dresses

loans.name: Rhode

texts.fr: Rhode est une femme de 38 ans, célibataire. elle a ouvert un mini kiosque dans un quartier de la ville qu'elle gère depuis 02 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des crédits de communications en gros (MTN, ORANGE, CAMTEL) afin d'augmenter son stock de crédit.
