Standardiste dans un hôtel et en même temps revendeuse de bazins, elle exerce cette seconde activité à domicile. Les demandes des clients augmentent de jour en jour et n’arrivant pas à les satisfaire tous, elle se tourne vers WAGES pour faire un premier prêt afin d’acheter des marchandises (bazins) et répondre aux besoins de ses derniers. Elle souhaite avoir une famille épanouie et créer une boutique pour exposer ses marchandises. Elle a démarré en 2010.
texts.en: Dédé is 31 years old and married to a retailer. They have two children in their care, who are 11 years old and four years old respectively and both at school. She is a hotel receptionist and at the same time retails damask fabric, carrying out this secondary activity at home. Customer demand is increasing on a daily basis and, as she cannot satisfy this demand, she is turning to WAGES for a first loan so she can buy goods (damask) and respond to her customers' demand. She would like to see her family flourish and set up a shop to display her goods. She started this business in 2010.

loans.use: to buy damask

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Jennifer who is married with an 11-year-old child. She additionally takes care of her younger sister. Jennifer established her cassette business in 2011. She began her business because she wanted to fight against poverty and she works six days a week, 13 hours a day. Jennifer earns about 2,500,000 SLL each month. 

Jennifer is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to buy blank CD and DVDs. She hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 429,000 SLL. In the future, Jennifer plans to establish a film industry. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy blank CD and DVDs

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le premier cycle du banc villageois, il regroupe 15 femmes du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
La responsable madame Kène est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, la main levée et habillée d'un grand boubou rose. Elle est âgée de 43 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 1 fille et 3 garçons.
Elle s'active dans l'embouche depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience. 
Avec son nouveau crédit de 200 000 francs cfa elle va acheter des moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de toute sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group was set up during the Banc Villageois' first cycle and comprises 15 women from the same village who are united by good social and professional relations. The person in charge of the group, Kène, is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and wearing a large pink boubou. She is 43 years old, married and mother to four children: one girl and three boys. She has been active in the animal fattening business for a long time and has good experience. With her new loan of 200,000FCFA she is going to buy sheep which she will raise and resell at her town's weekly markets. The profits she makes will enable her to provide for all her family's food, schooling and health needs and boost her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Maguette's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 femmes a intégré le banc villageois depuis son cycle premier.
Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles depuis longtemps.
La responsable madame Penda est une femme mariée âgée de 27 ans ayant à sa charge 4 enfants qui lui sont confiés, dont 2 garçons et 2 filles qui sont tous scolarisés.
Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée en bleu.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de fruits depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce secteur.  
Son nouveau crédit de 110 000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer des sacs d'oranges et d’arachides qu'elle va revendre au détail sur la table installée devant la porte de son domicile qui fait office de boutique.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de renforcer ses épargnes dans le but de pérenniser son activité de commerce.
texts.en: This group of 22 women joined the Banc Villageois on its first cycle. They have been united by good social and professional relationships for a long time. The person in charge of the group, Penda, is a 27-year old married woman who has four children who have been entrusted to her care: two boys and two girls, all at school. She is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and dressed in blue. She has had a fruit business for a long time and has good experience in this field. Her new loan of 110,000FCFA will enable her to buy sacks of oranges and groundnuts which she will sell on a retail basis on a table in front of the front door of her house which serves as a shop. The profits she makes will allow her to boost her savings so that she can maintain her business over the long term.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and oranges for a small business.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 58 años de edad, vive juntos a sus dos hijas quienes trabajan y costean sus gastos personales y también le brindan ayuda para los gastos del hogar. Rosa es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, ya que siempre se ha destacado por ser responsable y trabajadora. Rosa se gana la vida vendiendo productos medicinales de muy buena marca y de mucha confianza, los cuales los comercializa de forma ambulante y realizando visitas de casa en casa para dar a conocer los productos, así mismo comercializa perfumes, cosméticos y otros más. Ella cuenta con varios clientes fijos, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos medicinales y así también aumentar la cantidad de cosméticos que vende. Con esto Rosa tiene la ilusión de mejorar notablemente sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 and lives together with her two daughters who work and pay for their personal expenses and also support Rosa with the household expenses. Rosa is someone with good character references since she has always stood out for being responsible and hard working. 

Rosa makes a living selling medical products that are a well trusted, good brand. She sells them as a traveling vendor, making visits from house to house to let people know about the products. She also sells perfumes, cosmetics, and other products. She has several regular customers, which is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. She wants to invest in the purchase of a greater amount of medical products as well as increase the amount of cosmetics she sells. With this loan, Rosa hopes to notably increase her sales

loans.use: Purchase medical products and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Blanca Mercedes

texts.es: Blanca de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, ambos son dos personas muy trabajadoras y muy responsables en todos sus proyectos, siempre con el deseo de ser mejores en la vida y salir adelante. Blanca trabaja comercializando ropa para mujeres y niños, la cual vende de forma ambulante en distintas colonias y barrios del departamento en que reside, Blanca siempre trata de adquirir ropa de buena calidad y precios accesibles ya que de esta forma se asegura mantener sus ganancias estables. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir, variando en colores, tallas y estilos. Con esto blanca contara con más productos para vender a buenos precios y de esto modo mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is 53 years old, and she lives with her husband.  Both of them are very hard working people, and they are very responsible in all of their endeavors.  They always have the desire to be better in life and to get ahead.

Blanca works selling clothes for women and children.  She sells in an itinerant manner in different suburbs and neighborhoods in the department in which she lives.  Blanca always tries to get good quality clothes at affordable prices.  This way she assures herself of maintaining stable income.

She is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can buy a greater quantity of garments in a variety of colors, sizes, and styles.  By doing so, Blanca will have more products to sell at good prices.  This way she will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Madlen Anne

texts.es: Madlen de 33 años de edad, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, vive únicamente junto a su hija de once años de edad quien depende por completo de ella. Madlen trabaja como secretaria lo que le permite contar con un trabaja estable, a pesar de esto ella busca diversas formas de poder darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija y que no les haga falta nada en el hogar, es por esto que también trabaja comercializando cosméticos como: perfumes, maquillaje, cremas y otros más, esto representa una gran ayuda para ella y su economía.  Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y así seguir adelante con su negocio, surtiendo la cantidad de productos de belleza que vende, lo que le servirá para vender más y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Madlen, age 33, is a responsible and hard-working woman who puts forth great effort in order to get ahead.  She lives only with her 11 year old daughter, who is completely dependent upon her.

Madlen works as a secretary, which allows her to have a stable job.  In spite of this, she looks for different ways to be able to give her little daughter the best and so that they will not lack anything in their home.  That is why she also works selling cosmetics like perfume, make-up, creams, and others.  This represents a big help for her and her financial situation.

That is the reason that she is requesting a loan from Integral.  This way she will get ahead with her business.  She will do this by stocking beauty products that she sells.  This will help her to sell more and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Arame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 02/12/2008, il est composé de 22 femmes issues du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Nogoye est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, la main levée, habillée d'un grand boubou bleu fleuri.
Elle est âgée de 51 ans mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 5 garçons et 3 filles.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de manioc depuis bientôt 10 ans et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Son nouveau crédit de 75,000 francs cfa lui permettra d'acheter des sacs de manioc qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du petit marché de son village.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group was set up on 2nd December 2008 and is made up of 22 women all from the same village and united by good social and professional relationships. Nogoye is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised and wearing a large blue flowery boubou. She is 51 years old, married and mother to eight children: five boys and three girls. She has been active in the cassava business for almost ten years and has good experience in this field. Her new loan of 75,000FCFA will enable her to buy sacks of cassava, which she will resell on a retail basis at the small market in her village. The profits she makes will allow her to pay her children's schooling costs and boost her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cassava, which she will resell in her local market

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 45 years old. He is married to Jackline and they have been blessed with eight children between four to 19 years of age. He runs a spare parts shop, and he has been in business for 10 years. Right now, his monthly income is KES 45,000.

William is borrowing of KES 50,000 to purchase motorbike and bicycle spare parts. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business by adding more stock. 

This is his fourth loan, and he successfully paid his previous loans. William's hope and dream is to ensure his family is stable.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for motorbikes and bicycles

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Brnakot village of Syunik region. She is married with a child and is engaged in agriculture. Gayane keeps livestock which currently includes 2 cows, 10 sheep and 10 chickens. She cultivates wheat and potatoes, as well as owns a plot of land where nut, apple and pear trees are grown. With the help of her husband, Gayane works hard to gather a good harvest and cover the family's basic needs.

Now Gayane needs some financial support for covering farming costs. She has applied for this loan to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and to cover fuel costs. This will enable her to feed the livestock. It is very important for Gayane and her husband to cover fuel costs and take the gathered harvest to the market.

Gayane hopes that the loan will help her to gather more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and to cover fuel costs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25 years old from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2009. Mohammad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy goods and a new refrigerator. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy goods and a new refrigerator

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka lives Mwambalasi, Kenya. She is 27 years old, lives in her parents’ house, and has a 14-year-old child.

For the past 4 years, Mwaka has been selling used charcoal and making local soap. She is busy working long hours on her business and this makes her proud. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and making a profit.

Mwaka is requesting a loan amounting to 50,000 KES to purchase charcoal for resale. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: James S.'s Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from this group of borrowers living and working in Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone. 

These able and dedicated teachers have just concluded repaying their last Kiva loan and are very grateful to all Kiva lenders who made that loan possible for them. That loan created a huge impact in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use it to repair their houses. 

Having successfully finished repaying that loan, they have again reapplied for a new loan of 6,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones to further meet unresolved or new challenges. 

Featured leader James is again going to use his share of the loan to buy house building materials in order to continue with the house building project he had begun with his first Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron and corrugated zinc for the construction of a family home.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is grateful for the previous loan and says it was helpful to her business. She is now requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Mevlud

texts.en:
Mevludi is 48 years old. He lives in Zestaponi District, West Georgia, with his wife and four children (three of them are under-aged). Mevludi leads his family's small-scale agricultural business. He runs a family-owned dairy farm, with two calves and two milk cows. Mevludi produces cheese and sells it in the village. In addition, he owns four pigs and sells piglets seasonally. The income is not enough to provide Mevludi and his family with adequate living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Mevludi has requested a loan from Credo to restart his seasonal business. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with fewer conditions to the country's rural poor for business start-ups and restart-ups. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of their low incomes, and they often do not have access to credit. With the loan, Mevludi will purchase chickens to restart a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard. He will raise them to sell them for a higher price. He hopes that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and restart his poultry farm

loans.name: Luz Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Luz y su esposo trabajan de sol a sol todos los días, el como soldador y ella con su negocio de pulpería vendiendo diferentes productos como ropa nueva, cosméticos, joyas y productos perecederos para ayudarse a obtener mas ingresos y cumplir con las necesidades de sus 3 hijos quienes cada día son mas grandes y los gastos son mayores. Con este treceavo credito quiere comprar granos básicos, cosméticos, productos lácteos, siempre a como ha venido invirtiendo en sus créditos anteriores para con el negocio, así ha salido adelante con la familia.
texts.en: Luz and her husband work from sunrise to sunset every day. He is a welder. She runs her small grocery, offering a variety of items like clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, and perishables to earn extra income to pay the ever-increasing expenses to support their three children. As with previous loans, she will use the funds from her 13th loan cycle to invest in her business and buy staples, cosmetics, and milk products so that she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy staples, cosmetics, and milk products.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Don Víctor, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio del Negrito Yoro. El tiene su propio negocio de zapatería, realiza trabajos de reparación y reconstrucción de calzado en general. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y lleva 20 años aproximadamente de tenerlo y ha sido su fuente de ingresos familiares. El préstamo que ha decidido tomar es para comprar materiales como pegamento, hilos y plantillas y es por 12,000 lempiras. Con esta inversión va mantener inventario de materiales para atender mejor a sus clientes.  Su meta es obtener ganancias para tener solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Don Victor is 53 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the town of Negrito Yoro.

Victor has his own shoe shop where he repairs and rebuilds all types of footwear. The business is located in his home and he has been in this line of work for approximately 20 years since it provide a source of family income. The loan he decided to take is in the amount of 12,000 HNL and will be used to buy materials such as adhesive, thread, and insoles. With this investment, Victor will maintain his inventory of materials so that he can provide better service to his customers. His goal is to generate income so that he will be financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy adhesive, thread, insoles, and other supplies for repairing shoes.
